Spell Focus
Tracker
Two Weapon Combo
Weapon Brawling
Weapon Focus
Weapon Kata

Awareness

This skill represents a character’s ability to notice subtle
changes that reveal information about the natural environment
by the actions of nature. Nature rolls have their Difficulty Level
decreased by one step (i.e. what would be Very Hard for everybody
else is only Hard for this character). A successful Nature roll may
also allow the character to notice that the behavior of animal life
seems unusual which may, in turn, indicate the presence of an
impending natural disaster, predatory animals, or perhaps the
movement of several people, in the area.
Drive Point: The character notices the subtleties in the
change of environment (outdoors only) just in time to
avoid falling into a trap, being surprised or ambushed.
The character and those within their small group are
not surprised and may take actions normally, including
gaining their full DM against traps if applicable.

Ambush

With this Special Skill, you may take a Half Action to
prepare your attack. The -4 for taking a Half Action with a
Full Action is reduced by 1 for every 5 ranks you have in the
Stealth skill. You make a Stealth Roll, and gain a +1 to your
Attack Bonus for every Success Level you receive in your
result. The target of this attack, which may be made with any
weapon, must be in either a disadvantaged position, Held,
Surprised or Prone and unaware of your approach.
Drive Point: The character may make a murderous
surprise attack from any position while using a weapon
with the Backstab quality, as part of a normal attack.
The strike increases the weapon’s Damage Rating by 6
and the attack ignores any armor the target is wearing
or any natural armor for Criticals.

Command

The character has a strong aura of authority and may
command and/or rally allies during combat. The use of
Command is a Full Action. The character is able to influence
up to 1 ally per rank that they have in the Leadership skill,
providing they share a language and are able to heard and
seen. The Leadership skill can also be used to indicate the
Knight’s knowledge of military tactics and siege weapons
in place of the Warfare skill. When using this skill to direct
others, a successful skill roll results in a +1 per Success Level
bonus for Helping those he is commanding. This can also
apply to Saves against fear effects as well.
Drive Point: Allows a character to give a rousing
speech to inspire their allies as if making a successful
Leadership skill roll. Treat attempted use of Command
as if the character achieved a Critical Success.

Arcane Scholar

The character has made an in-depth study of one single
School of Magic. This provides him with a special +1 bonus
to casting all known spells within this School, even those
gained after acquiring this skill. He also gains additional +1
Mana Point per level as well.
Drive Point: The character may cast his next spell as if
he were 5 levels (i.e. +10 to the spell casting roll, and
able to use up to 5 more Mana in the spell without
risking Abnormal Spell Failure) higher than he
actually is. This would allow the character to cast a
spell that he might not normally be able to attempt.

55

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Drive Point: The item being enchanted is enhanced in
some manner (based upon the item being enchanted;
refer to the specific item section for details) for each
Drive expended in its creation.

Derring-Do

A character with this skill excels in using their charm and
wit to show off to others, in turn bolstering their own bravado.
For a character with this skill, the player will describe the type of
audacious action (i.e. a quip, oath, stealing a kiss for luck, etc.) and
then makes a Swashbuckling skill roll. He receives a base bonus of
2, and then a +1 for every Success Level that he achieved in the
Swashbuckling skill roll to a following skill/attack roll.
Drive Point: The character may use a Drive Point to make a
dramatic entrance on to the scene, if he is not already there.
All foes must make a Will Save or be Stunned for the rest
of the round. The attack level of this save is the number of
ranks that the character has in his Swashbuckling skill.

Evasion

This Special Skill represents a character’s ability to react
quickly to surprise events, such as being ambushed or setting
off a trap unawares. This skill may be used to avoid incoming
attacks or hazards that the character is unaware of. The player
makes an Acrobatics skill roll (as a Free Action) as a Conflicting
Action and if successful, the character evades. When a character
successfully evades, they may react normally as if they were
aware of the situation before it happened. Against attacks, the
character may choose to use any defenses at their disposal,
including turning to face the attack or casting an instant spell.
Drive Point: The character automatically avoids an attack
or hazard, even if they were previously unaware of it.
The attack or hazard automatically misses the character.

Distraction

A character with this skill can disrupt the concentration
of a target by taunting, yelling or performing a physical
action (i.e. throwing a rock). Distraction can only be used
once for each Action it is used against. The player must
describe the distraction before making a Conflicting Action
roll (Influence vs. target’s Action Skill).
Drive Point: Allows for using Distraction to affect up to
1 target per rank that they have in the Influence skill.

Focus

This skill allows the character to focus their life energy to
achieve some astounding, somewhat mystical results using a
variation of his Meditation skill. This Special Skill has three
primary abilities that it can grant to those that take the time
and effort to learn it. When using this skill, the character
cannot be wearing anything heavier than Soft Leather Armor
(torso) or bracers (of any type) and cannot be wielding a
weapon or shield, unless it is part of a Weapon Kata. Each of
the three uses of this Special Skill is described below:
Attack: The character may take a Half Action to focus before
making his attack. If successful, the Attack Roll will receive
a +1 bonus for every SL gained in a Meditation roll.
Defense: Upon making a successful Half Action skill roll, the
character may add +1 to his DM for every SL gained in
rolling his Meditation skill. The character spends their Free
Action each round thereafter to maintain this ability. This
bonus applies for the entire round in which it is declared.
The skill roll is made at the time that this is declared, not in
normal initiative resolution order. The character may not
use any other Focus abilities while using this one.
Healing: This use of the skill allows the character to heal faster
than normal. Upon a successful Full Action skill roll, the
character will heal a number of Hit Points (HP) over the
course of an hour, which is spent resting or in mediation.
The number of HP healed is equal to the number of Success
Levels earned multiplied by the character’s Hits Multiplier.
Drive Point: For each Drive point, the character gains +1
Success Level to the results of his Meditation roll. This may
allow him to exceed the normal +5 maximum.
Alternatively, for one Drive point the character does
not need to make a Meditation roll, instead automatically
treating his Focus attempt as if he received a Critical Success.
The choice of spending a Drive point and how it is
spent must be made before the skill is attempted.

Dual Weapons

The basics of two weapons in combat is covered in the section
on Fighting with Two Weapons (p. 130), and apply here with
adjustment. This skill represents using two identical weapons of
either Short or Hand length. This skill may only be acquired for
use with weapons that have the Weapon Quality of Swift.
Dual Weapons may be acquired multiple times, once for
each pair of weapons to be used with this skill.
•• The Damage Rating of each weapon is increased by 1.
•• Attacks with the off-hand weapon are Free Actions
rather than their normally required Action type.
•• Each weapon may be used to parry/attack different foes
separately, with the AB reductions applying against that
foe only. Against a single foe, the amount applied to DM
from parrying is subtracted from both weapons.
•• For every 3 ranks in the primary weapon skill, remove a
single -1 modifier from the ones given by Fighting with Two
Weapons (i.e. the -2 and -6 can be reduced to -2 and -5 if
you have 3 ranks. -1 and -5 respectively if you have 6 ranks,
etc. - Players choice as to whis modifier is reduced).
Drive Point: The character is able to make attacks without
any negative modifiers, and the parry from each
weapon is applied to the character’s DM individually
(i.e. the player assigns 3 points from each weapon to
Parry, the character gains total of +6 to DM).

Enchantment

This skill allows somebody who is skilled in Alkemics to
enchant items and embed spells into them. It also allows those
who have the Arcana skill to create runestones and allows for
the embedding of symbols into stationary mediums. Refer to
the section Alchemy 101 (p. 189) for more information.
56

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Fury

Martial Arts

Those with this Special Skill are able to use their Battle Frenzy
skill to enter a Fury using just a Half Action. Upon entering the
Fury, the character gains a +2 bonus plus an additional +1 for
every Success Level gained in their skill roll. This bonus applies
to all skill rolls and Attacks that use Brawn, and he will suffer
no penalty for being Bruised. Fury can be ended by a calming
spell, certain Influence skill based actions, or unconsciousness.
While in a Fury, the character is not able to Parry, and they will
always attack the nearest foe. Once there are no foes standing,
they may take a Half Action to end the Fury.
Drive Point: Allows a character to enter or leave Fury
immediately as a Free Action.

A character that has learned the Martial Arts gains a +3 bonus
to their Defensive Modifier (DM), as long as he is not wearing
torso armor heavier than Soft Leather. The character is also
trained to be able to parry weapon attacks when unarmed.
Additionally, the character also gains a +1 to the Damage
Ratings on all their unarmed and Weapon Kata attacks for every
3 ranks that they have in their Brawl skill (up to a max of +5).
Characters with this Special Skill also treat their unarmed
attacks as having the following Weapon Qualities (p. 103):
Punches: Martial, Swift, treated as a Hand weapon;
Kicks: Martial, Swift, treated as a Long weapon;
Grapple/Wrestling: Agile, Martial, Swift, also does Hits equal
to a Punch if successful, treated as a Hand weapon;
Sweeps/Throws: Agile, Martial, Swift, also does Hits equal to a
Kick if successful, treated as a Long weapon.

Legerdemain

The character that has this Special Skill has training in
performing tricks and sleights of hand in front of audiences.
Making things appear and disappear easily fooling the
unwary. This grants the character a +2 to all Trickery and
Deceive skill rolls.
Drive Point: The character may instantly draw, as a Free
Action, any item to hand that they have about their
person, including in their backpack. The item must be
able to be held in a single hand.

A character with the Special Skill, Martial Arts, may use
their Martial Arts (all four types of unarmed attacks counts
as one weapon for this), or Weapon Katas (p. 60) with Two
Weapon Fighting (p. 130) and also with the Special Skills, Dual
Weapons (p. 56) and Two Weapon Combo (p. 59).
Drive Point: Allows a character to unleash a whirlwind
of unarmed strikes, making a single attack with each
opponent they are engaged with, at their full Attack Bonus.
Alternatively, they may make two attacks against a
single foe, both at full Attack Bonus.
Regardless, all attacks are resolved separately.

Light Touch

A character with this Special Skill has been taught
how to better use their sense of touch when dealing with
delicate actions with their hands. This grants a +2 bonus to
Gimmickry and Trickery skill rolls.
Drive Point: The character gets to add his Dexterity
to any rolls involving this Special Skill for the entire
scene. This is in addition to the normal stat that would
apply. This must be done before the rolls are made.

Minstrel

A character with this skill has received training on the
best ways to entertain and please crowds with their tales and
songs. They gain a +2 to all Lore, and Arts (Music) skill rolls.
Drive Point: The character may inspire their allies with
a tune, verse or quote, providing a special +4 bonus to
a single action or roll. This ability must be used before
the roll takes place and is a Free Action.

Long Reach

The skill represents a character’s expertise in using the
extended reach of polearms. Polearms are most effective
when exploiting their reach, especially against large targets;
however, they are also a good defense against opponents
moving into attack. The weapons, Quarterstaff and Short
Spear are also considered to have Reach if used 2-handed by
a character with this skill.
Whenever an opponent moves into range of the character
while he is using a polearm, the character may make an attack
before the target engages. This attack is not in addition to other
actions, it just happens outside of the normal initiative order.
Drive Point: The character may split his Attack Bonus
against multiple foes, and make a single attack against
each of them, as a single Full Action, as long as they are
with the limits of the polearm’s length.
The character may also use the Martial Move,
Maintain Distance (p. 132) against 1 foe for every two
ranks in the Polearm skill without penalty.

Mounted Combat

Those with this skill are specifically trained to fight from
their mount in combat. Characters with this skill gain a +2
to their Ride skill rolls for controlling their mount while in
combat, and are able to control their mount as a Free Action,
instead of a Half Action like it normally would be. Additionally,
when making the Ride skill roll, the character gains a +1 to their
Attack Bonus for each Success Level that they receive in the
Ride skill roll.
Drive Point: The character may add their ranks in the Ride
skill to their Attack Bonus for the round. They also do not
need to make a Ride skill roll to control their mount, only
spend a Free Action to do so.

57

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Drive Point: The character may draw their weapon as a Free
Action. Alternatively, if the character has the minimum
number of required ranks to make multiple attacks, they
may do so without the -4 modifier for the entire scene.

Piety

This Special Skill represents a character’s ability to perceive
the emanations of magical and supernatural sources from
other planes within a 30’ radius. A character using their Piety
may make Perception rolls to notice phenomena related to
the other planes (minimum of a Very Hard task). This could
include the presence of beings from other planes, spells cast
using magic tied to other planes (Divinism and Diabolism
especially). It would require 1 Success Level to be spent on
the results to determine if the source is Divine, Neutral or
Infernal in nature. A second Success Level can be spent to
determine more detail, such as Demonic or Devilish or from
the Ocher Realms (the planes of the Undead).
Drive Point: The character’s patron grants them True
Sight, the ability to see the truth. This allows them to see
the true form of anybody who has been shapeshifted
and to see through illusions, and to see invisible for a
single scene.

Reconnoiter

The character has an uncanny knack for sensing people
and creatures that lie ahead. The character is able to make a
Perception roll and determine the number and type (humanoid/
animal) of any animate beings within a 100’ radius outdoors
and 30’ indoors. If a creature is purposefully hiding then the
skill roll should be resolved as a Conflicting Action.
Drive Point: The character may make a Nature skill roll
to detect the presence of other hazards such as traps
or natural phenomena that may cause harm. They are
able to locate the distance and direction of the hazard.
If the hazard is purposefully hidden then the Skill roll
should be resolved as a Conflicting Action.

Sea Legs

Protection

Ahoy Matey! Your life of living and moving on or near the
sea has granted you a more stable stance than others seem to
have. You gain a +2 to all physical actions performed while
on a ship (movement, combat, etc.) or on any other unstable
surface (floating docks, small rocks, scree, etc.).
Drive Point: For the entire scene, the character is immune
to any effects or actions that would result in him falling
prone. He cannot be tripped or knocked down. Instead,
depending on the action, he ends up 5 feet from his
original position as he stumbles to stay upright.

A character with this Special Skill is able to protect others
without overly endangering himself. The character is able to
share his Shield bonus and any DM from Parrying with one
additional person who is adjacent to himself. He does this
without losing the shield and Parry benefits from his own DM.
Drive Point: The character is able use his full Attack
Bonus to Parry against all foes, and still use the full
Attack Bonus to make an attack as well.

Prowler

Those with this Special Skill have received training as what is
sometimes called a second story man. They receive a +2 bonus
to climbing (Athletics skill), Gimmickry, and Stealth rolls.
Drive Point: The character gets to add his Dexterity
to any rolls involving this Special Skill for the entire
scene. This is in addition to the normal stat that would
apply. This must be done before the rolls are made.

Second Sight

This Special Skill represents a character’s ability to perceive the
emanations of magical and supernatural sources of a Spiritual
nature within a 30’ radius. Nature Spirits are normally invisible
while on the mortal planes, but not to those with the Second
Sight. They are able to see them plainly. This also allows them
to use a Perception roll to determine the presence of other spirits,
including undead spirits. While they can also sense magical
emanations like those with Sixth Sense, such rolls would be one
step more difficult for those with the Second Sight.
Drive Point: The character gains the ability to fully see all
types of Spirits, including Undead Spirits, and magical
auras, even around those rendered invisible, for the
duration of a single scene.

Quick Draw

This skill represents the precision training of the character
in quickly drawing readied items. Every five full ranks in that
he has in the associated Weapon Skill will reduce the -4 penalty
by 1 point for taking a Half Action together with a Full Action
when drawing weapons or loading missile weapons.
Furthermore, this can be used to make multiple attacks
per round. If using a Hand or Short weapon, a character with
10 ranks in their Weapon Skill may make 2 such attacks with
a -4 modifier to both attacks. This modifier is reduced by 1
point for every 5 ranks over 10 that the character has. For
Long/Longest weapons, this requires that the character have
a minimum of 15 ranks in the Weapon Skill to make two
attacks in a round, with a -4 modifier to both attacks and
this modifier is reduced by 1 for every five ranks over 15 that
the character has.

58

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Sharpshooter

Spell Focus

This Special Skill represents a character’s ability to
precisely aim ranged weapons to eliminate the advantages of
those in cover. The character must Aim (p. 125) for at least
1 Full Action, gaining all benefits of doing so, and then make
a Sharpshooter skill roll, using his Ranged skill bonus, which
will be followed by the actual Attack Roll. The Sharpshooter
roll will use the cover bonus that the target currently has as
a difficulty modifier.
If the roll is successful, the target’s bonus for cover is
completely removed. On a Critical Success, the target is caught
unaware of the lack of cover they have, and the character
gains +2 to their subsequent attack roll. On a Partial Success,
the target’s bonus for cover is reduced by half.
Drive Point: For a single Drive point, the Sharpshooter
only requires a Half Action. For 2 Drive points, this can
be done as a Free Action. For 3 Drive Points, this is a
Free Action, and does not require a roll, and is treated
as if the character received a Critical Success.

This Special Skill represents the character’s expertise in
using a single specific spell. Upon gaining this Special Skill,
the character must select a single spell to be focused on. A
different spell can be focused on for each time this Special
Skill is acquired. However, a character may never have more
than 5 focused spells in total.
You gain a special +1 bonus for casting this spell. You are
also treated as if you have 2 ranks more than you actually
have, but solely Abnormal Spell Failure and Spell Fumbles.
Drive Point: The character may treat all spells as if he had
Spell Focus in them for a single scene.

Tracker

With this Special Skill, the character has been highly
trained in the art of following and identifying and reading
tracks. The character gains a +2 to their Hunting skill to find
and follow tracks, and a +2 to their Nature skill for reading
information from them, such as the age of the tracks, the
type of being or creature they belong to, etc.
Drive Point: The character is able to move at double the
normal speed while tracking. Alternatively, they may
use their skill to make sure that they and anybody with
them leave no tracks behind for an entire scene.

Sixth Sense

This Special Skill represents a character’s ability to
perceive the emanations of magical and supernatural sources
within a 30’ radius. A character using their Sixth Sense may
make Perception Rolls to notice the presence, but not exact
whereabouts, of creatures and objects that have been turned
invisible due to a supernatural source, such as a magical
spell (a Very Hard task). A character using this skill might
also be able to detect the presence of illusionary magic (a
Very Hard task) and those using any shape changing ability
(a Heroic task), but not the true nature of the target. The
subtle emissions of magic from magical trap triggers may
also possibly be detected using this skill.
Drive Point: The character can see illusions as a
translucent overlay over what they cover, see the
shapechanger’s true form as a translucent shadow
form, but without true detail, and see invisible people
and object that have been turned invisible as they
appear outlined in a colored glow to his sight.

Two Weapon Combo

The basics of two weapons in combat is covered in the
section on Fighting with Two Weapons (p. 130), and this
skill represents using two different weapons with a combined
length of 5 feet or less, with the shorter of the two weapons
always being the off-hand weapon.
Two Weapon Combo must be acquired separately for
each weapon combination to receive the benefits of this
Special Skill.
The Attack Bonuses for each weapon will used the
appropriate weapon skill as normal, and those with this skill
receive the following benefits:
•• If the off-hand weapon is Hand or Short in length,
it gains Parry(1). If the weapon already has Parry, its
benefit is increased by 1.
•• Attacks with the off-hand weapon are Free Actions
rather than their normal required Action type.
•• Each weapon may be used to parry/attack different foes
separately, with the AB reductions applying against that
foe only. Against a single foe, the amount applied to DM
from parrying is subtracted from both weapons.
•• For every 3 ranks in the primary weapon skill, remove a
single -1 modifier from the ones given by Fighting with Two
Weapons (i.e. the -2 and -6 can be reduced to -2 and -5 if
you have 3 ranks. -1 and -5 respectively if you have 6 ranks,
etc. - Players choice as to whis modifier is reduced).
Drive Point: The character is able to make attacks without
the any negative modifiers, and the parry from each
weapon is applied to the character’s DM individually
(i.e. the player assigns 3 points from each weapon to
Parry, the character gains total of +6 to DM).
59

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Additionally, by focusing in this weapon, the character gains
the ability to make multiple attacks with it. If they have 10 ranks or
more, they may split their Attack Bonus into 2 separate bonuses,
and make two separate attacks using a single Full Action. The
attacks need not be against the same foe, but the targets must be
adjacent. The second attack receives a -4 modifier. The bonus of
the second attack must be equal to or less than the bonus of the
first attack, before the -4 modifier is applied.
Example: Argorn, the Verdyri Scout, has taken
Weapon Focus in Small Sword. At third level,
he has 10 ranks (from purchased, Culture, and
Vocation) in Small Sword, giving him a total bonus
of +12. He may split his attacks in two, gaining a
+7 against the first foe he is facing, and +1 ((12-7
= 5) 5 - 4 = 1) against the second foe.
When they get 20 or more ranks in their Weapon Skill, the
second attack loses the -4 modifier, and at 30 or more ranks, they
can split their Attack Bonus in 3 separate amounts, and only the
last (third) attack receives a -4 modifier.
If the focused weapon is a ranged weapon, that has the
Weapon Quality, Load (1), it can be loaded or reloaded
using a Free Action as if it had the Weapon Quality, Quick
Load. This allows for making 2 attacks per round, with the
second attack receiving a -4 modifier.
And if the ranged weapon already has the Weapon Quality,
Quick Load, and the character has more than 10 ranks in the
skill, that weapon may be used to make two attacks a round
without the -4 penalty that would normally apply.
If it has the Quality, Load (2), or higher then the load time
is reduced by 1 for every 10 ranks in the skill.
Drive Point: The character treats all weapons as if he has
Weapon Focus for them for the length of one scene.

Weapon Brawling

This Special Skill represents the character’s ability to utilize
weapons in ways that they were not meant to be used, such
as throwing a sword, smashing an opponent with pommel
of a weapon, and even using a shield to bash a target. Melee
weapons gain a range of 10 feet (5 feet for weapons with the
Heavy or Mighty quality) and ranged weapons may be used
in melee to strike at an opponent.
When attacking with a weapon in a way it is not designed
for, the character may use his the weapon’s normal skill with
a -4 modifier or use his Brawl skill bonus to attack.
A character may also use a Weapon Brawling attack using the
same guidelines as Fighting with Two Weapons (p. 130), except
that both attacks use the primary hand (i.e. there is no off-hand
penalty applied).
Weapon Brawling attacks are treated as Hand weapons for
making Close Quarters attacks.
Drive Point: The character receives no negative modifiers
to either attack for making a Weapon Brawling attack.

Weapon Focus

This Special Skill represents the character’s expertise in
using a single specific type weapon. Upon gaining this Special
Skill, the character must select a single type of weapon, such
as short sword, longsword, or even a short bow to be focused
on. A different weapon can be focused on for each time this
Special Skill is acquired. However, a character may never have
more than 5 focused weapons total.
For a focused weapon, the character gains a +1 bonus to
all uses of the weapon. This includes all Attack Bonuses, its
Damage Ratings, and any other uses for it where a skill roll
might be required, such as with any Martial Moves (p. 131)
that may be attempted with the weapon.
If the focused weapon is a melee weapon, then for every 5
ranks that the character has in the associated Weapon Skill, he
reduces the Critical Failure (i.e. Fumble) Range of the focused
weapon by 1, to a minimum of 2. This also gives a -1 modifier to
any actual Fumble rolls for the weapon.

Weapon Kata

A character must learn the Special Skill, Martial Arts,
before they learn this Special Skill. For every two ranks that
the character has in his Brawl skill, he may select 1 weapon
to be used as a Kata weapon. They may make attacks with
those weapons using their Brawl skill.
Kata weapons deal their normal damage plus the bonus
damage from the Martial Arts skill (+1 hit for every 3 ranks
in the Brawl skill, up to a maximum of +5). Backgrounds
and/or spells that apply to Martial Arts damages do not
apply to damage from Kata weapons.
Drive Point: The character treats all of his Kata weapons
as if he had Weapon Focus for them for the duration
of a single scene.

Gifts

Your character was not born in a vacuum. He or she has a
past, one that stretches back further than their own personal
history. They often carry parts of this on their adventures.
This could be a trinket or heirloom passed down to them,
some sort of special knack for something. It could be their wyrd,
or destiny calling to them. There are many different possibilities.
Each character has a specific number of Background Points
(BP), based on their Kin, which they now get to spend on the
options found in this chapter. All of the listed Background
options have 2 Tiers and each Tier has a specific cost. Should
a character purchase the Major Tier for an option, they also
automatically get the benefits of the Minor Tier as well.
These options are divided into two categories; Gifts and
Drawbacks. The Gifts expand your character in some fashion,
and the Drawbacks are defects or disadvantages that your
character has. If you take a Drawback, you get a one or more
BPs back, allowing you to spend more BPs overall. A character
may gain no more than 3 BPs from Drawbacks. You are not
required to take any Drawbacks if you do not want any.
A given Gift or Drawback may only be purchased once,
unless its description states otherwise. The different Tiers do
not count as separate Gifts for purchasing (i.e. purchasing
a Minor Ancient Heirloom counts as purchasing Ancient
Heirloom, so it cannot be purchased a second time).
Some Background Options may also have Requirements
that must be met in order to acquire that specific Option.

Ambidexterity

You are able to use both hands better than others.
Minor (1 BP): Any Action attempted with your off-hand
has the modifier changed from -4 to -2.
Major (3 BP): You do not have receive any modifiers (i.e.
the -4) when using your off-hand.

Ancient Heirloom

You’ve either inherited an ancient artifact, or acquired it
under unusual circumstances.
Minor (cost 1 BP): Choose an item in your character’s
starting equipment. That item grants you a +2 magical
bonus to a specific skill, acts as a +1 magical focus, or
lets you cast a Tier 1 spell of your choosing, twice a
day. Give it a name, an origin, and record it on your
character sheet.
Major (cost 3 BPs): The item also lets you cast a spell of
up to 3rd Tier twice a day, or a 5th Tier once a day.
However, the item is either stolen from its original
owner, who wants it back, or it is sought by a great evil.
Note: Spells cast by an item are not Scalable. They
will always only be castable in the form and at the
Tier that they were embedded into the item.
61

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Animal Affinity

Assassin

You have a special connection to animals.
Minor (1 BP): Select one type of animal, based on the
list of Animal Tongues (excluding Ancient), and gain
a +2 to all Reaction Rolls (p. 225) involving that type
of animal.
Major (3BP): Select 4 additional animal types (excluding
Ancient). Your bonus on Reaction Rolls (p. 225) is
now +4 for all 5 types of animals.

You have been trained in the deadly arts by a master assassin.
Minor (1 BP): Write your Allegiance about your ties to
your old master. You gain a +1 bonus in the Stealth
skill, a +2 bonus in the Ambuscade skill, and a special
+4 bonus to your Crafts(Herbcraft) skill rolls when
identifying, using, or preparing poisons.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, when you attack a Surprised
foe with a ranged weapon, you can treat that weapon
as if it had the Backstab Quality, provided that your
target is within the Base Range of your weapon.

Animal Speech

You have learned to speak to the animals. It does not
guarantee that the animal will speak with you. Most animals
tend to have an intelligence of small child, though some may
be more intelligent overall.
Minor (1 BP): You are able to speak one of the available
animal tongues, excluding the Ancient Tongue, to Rank 3.
Major (3 BPs): You are able to learn the languages of
the various types of animals as if they were any other
language. To learn the Ancient language requires
knowing all 10 of the other animal languages.

Bard of Ancient Tales

You have been taught the Ancient Tales of your Kin: tales
of heroes, gods, monsters, and mighty deeds, and you use
this knowledge to your advantage.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a +2 bonus to your Lore skill,
and whenever you Help one of your companions, you
always add the number of your Lore ranks (divided by
5 and rounded up) to the Helping bonus you grant. For
example, if you have 12 ranks in the Lore skill, when
you successfully Help one of your companions, you
grant them a total bonus of +5 (+2 for the successful
Helping Roll, and +3 for your ranks in Lore).
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, when you are in a safe
environment with your companions, you may take
some time to tell them a tale or sing them a song
about a situation similar to the one you’re facing. After
you’ve done so, you create a Bardic Inspiration Token
for each ally who listened, if they do not already have
one (use whatever you want to represent this token).
Those characters may, at any time, spend their Bardic
Inspiration Token to gain a bonus equal to your Lore
ranks (divided by 5, rounded up) to any Skill, Attack,
or Save Roll, even after they’ve rolled the dice. Once
used, the Bardic Inspiration Token is discarded.
Note: A character may only have a single Bardic
Inspiration Token at a time. Once the situation
that resulted in the creation of the token is over,
the token is discarded, even if it has not been used.

Animal Tongues
Avian: The language of birds.
Bovine: The language of herd animals such as cows,
goats, antelope and sheep.
Canine: The language of dogs, wolves, and other dog-like
animals.
Equine: The language of horses and other related
creatures.
Feline: The language of cats, both large and small.
Insectoid: The language of insects of various type, most
especially those of the giant variety.
Piscine: The language of fish and other aquatic animals.
Rodentia: This is the language of bats, mice, moles,
squirrels, raccoons and many other small animals.
Saurian: The language of lizards, reptiles and amphibians.
Simian: The language of apes, monkeys, and other apelike animals.
Ancient: According to legend, this is the first known
tongue, the language of dragons and other mythical
creatures. This language may only be learned once all
other Animal Tongues have been learned.

Battle Hardened

You survived many battles, and carry their scars on your
body, proving your valor and your worth as a seasoned warrior.
Minor (1 BP): You have an impressive scar somewhere on
your body; describe it. Increase your starting HPs by 15
and your Max Hits by +10.
Major (3 BPs): Increase your starting HPs by another 15 (+30
total) and increase your Hit Multiplier for your Kin by 1.

Beast Ring: This ring allows the wearer to
speak animal language at a time. To
change which animal language he
can speak, he will need to make
an Attunement roll (p. 282),
with failure only meaning that he
cannot change to that language
for 24 hours. (AP: 21 Cost: 315 gp)
62

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Major (3 BPs): You also gain a special +4 bonus to your
Wandering Rolls when you’re travelling through lands
controlled by Evil. Additionally, once per session, you
may ask the GM to reveal a weakness, vulnerability, or
idiosyncrasy of a servant of the Evil that you are facing.
Your past misdeeds, however, are hard to forget, and
many who know about it still treat you with suspicion,
or even outright hostility.
Note: For the purposes of this Background, Evil
is defined as true evil, not the petty little evils
that people are always perpetrating. This means
dealing with or tainted by Infernal forces such as
demons, devils, or undead.

Blade Bravo/Duelist

You have been immersed in a specific style of combat from a
young age. This allows you some special abilities with a single,
specific weapon.
Minor (2 BPs): Choose one specific melee weapon that has
the Weapon Quality of Swift. You treat the weapon as if it
were one step longer than normal (helps with Initiative).
You may also treat this weapon as having the Weapon
Qualities of Agile and Mighty.
Major (4 BPs): Choose a name for your combat style. This
style is one that fights with light armor (Soft Leather
or Padded), and a weapon with the Weapon Quality of
Swift. If the style does not include a second weapon or
other item, such as a shield, in your off-hand, you gain
a +3 to your Defensive Modifier (DM) when using this
style. If your style does include an object in your offhand, any DM modifiers provides are increased by +1
over what they may normally provide. Normal modifiers
for Two Weapon Fighting will still apply normally.
You may also treat any melee weapon with a Weapon
Quality of Swift as also having the Quality of Agile.

Destiny Sense

You have always been able to find what you are looking
for. It may take you a while, but you get there eventually.
Minor (1 BP): Upon spending a 10 minutes using the
Meditation skill, focused upon a desired person, place,
or object that you know well (or have had described to
you in detail), you will know, upon a successful skill
roll, in which direction it lies, but not how far or what
obstacles may lay in your path.
Major (3 BPs): As above, except that you will also get a
general sense of distance (i.e. how many days of travel
to get to it, if travelling in a straight line). this does not
take into account any potential obstacles.

Born to Saddle

Your riding ability is renowned among your people.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a superior riding breed of your
choice, appropriate for your Culture and Kin, and a
special +2 bonus to your Ride rolls. Give your mount a
name and record it on your character sheet.
Major (3 BPs): You also gain the special ability to automatically
pass Ride skill rolls during a mounted battle.

Eccentric

Other people often tell you that you’re strange. Some
would take offense to that, but you’re proud of what you are.
Minor (1 BP): Choose a Stat in which your Kin has a negative
modifier (or zero modifier, if no Stats with negative
modifiers). Increase the total value of that Stat by 1 point.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, choose one of your Kidred
Traits that has a negative impact. You ignore the negative
effects of that Trait. If your Kin does not have such a Trait,
gain +1 to your lowest Stat. However, other members of
your Kin tend to find you weird or unnatural.

Daredevil

Let others take “safe” choices and worry about the odds.
You are a hero; you are meant for greater things and know
that often fortune favors the bold.
Minor (1 BP): Whenever you use at least one point of
Drive while attempting an action with a Difficulty
Level of Very Hard or higher, you get a special +2
bonus to your Roll, in addition to the normal benefits
granted by the Drive expenditure.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, once per session when you
receive a Critical Failure in a Legendary or Mythical
Skill Roll, you gain a Drive Point.

Eloquence

You are a natural at casting spells, able to do so with a
beauty and a grace rarely found in others.
Minor (1 BP): You may cast all spells with Tiers equal to
your level or less as a Half Action. Even spells that have
been Scaled Up.
Major (3 BP): Spells with Tiers above your level may be
cast using a single Full Action.

Dark Past

You once served somebody truly Evil or one of their
lieutenants, but something or someone made you see the
errors of your ways. Now you’re one of Evil’s fiercest enemies.
Minor (1 BP): Your familiarity with the ways of the
enemy makes it easier for you to see through their
ploys. Once per day, you can automatically sense evil
within 50’ of yourself with no rolls required.

63

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Elven Mentor

Exceptional Training

You have been raised by or mentored by an Elf, and they
taught you a few things that you would not normally learn
from your Culture. This Background may only be acquired
by those who are not Elves.
Minor (1 BP): You trained under an Elven Swordmaster,
and may select any one 1-handed Bladed weapon with
the Weapon Quality, Swift, and use Dexterity as your Stat
for it, rather than Brawn. You may also treat that weapon
as if its length were one step longer than normal.
Major (4 BPs): Choose the Elven community that raised
you. You gain the Lore of the Ages Kindred Trait as if
you were a High Elf (+1 rank in each of 2 spells from
any one School of Magic).You may also use Dexterity
instead of Brawn as a Stat modifier for all 1-handed
Blades that have the Weapon Quality of Swift.

You’ve studied under a renowned mentor, who taught
you the secrets of a particular skill.
Minor (1 BP): Name your mentor. You gain a special +2
bonus in any one Skill of your choice, that you are normally
able to acquire (i.e. no spells if you are not a spell caster).
Major (2 BPs): Your mentor also left you an item specially
tailored to you as a keepsake. This item grants you a +2
Item Modifier to the chosen skill.

Fast Talker

You have the Gift of Gab, and are very good at confusing
and duping those with whom you share a language.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a +2 to all Deceive and Influence
rolls when attempting to confuse or trick a single
individual. This requires that you be able to speak the
same language as the target to at least Rank 3 Spoken.
Major (3 BPs): This allows you to use gain the above
bonus when attempting to use it on a group with a
size of up to two people for each rank you have in the
relative skill (i.e. You get the bonus for groups of to 20
people if you have 10 ranks in the relative skill).

Enhanced Sight

Your vision is better than anybody of your Kin. This
Background does not improve the vision capabilities of
those who already have the type of vision granted.
Minor (1 BP): You have Night Sight. Refer to Light &
Vision (p. 205) for more information on ranges for
this type of vision.
Major (2 BPs): You have Dark Sight. Refer to Light &
Vision (p. 205) for more information on ranges for
this type of vision.

Fleet-Footed

You move like the wind, leaving everyone else behind you.
When you run, you can truly show them the meaning of haste.
Minor (1 BP): Increase your Move Rate by 10 feet. You
can travel up to 1.5x the normal overland distance per
day, as long as you’re on foot and Unencumbered or
Lightly Encumbered.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, as long as you’re
Unencumbered or Lightly Encumbered, you can
Disengage as a Free Action and gain a special +4 bonus
to your DM for the rest of the Round if you take a
Movement Action.

Ensorcellment Cure

You have a rare gift. When you touch a person who has
been cursed in some manner, you can sometimes disrupt
the curse, freeing that person.
Minor (1 BP): Once per day, upon touching another
character, any magical affliction (lycanthropy,
petrification, etc.) that they suffer from must make a Save
or be permanently cured. If the affliction does not have a
level, then it will use the level of the person afflicted. The
affliction gains a +5 bonus to its Save roll.
Major (3 BP): Upon touching another character, any
magical affliction (lycanthropy, petrification, etc) that
they suffer from must make a Save or be permanently
cured. If the affliction does not have a level, then it will
use the level of the person afflicted. This ability may be
used once per day for each level that the character has.

Geared for Adventure

Your companions may joke about the quantity of gear
you manage to stuff in your backpack, but you know that
being prepared always pays well during an adventure.
Minor (1 BP): You can add two items with cost of 1 silver
piece or less (see the Equipment section) or one item
costing up to 5 silver pieces to your starting equipment.
Major (3 BPs): Include something about always being
well prepared in your Nature. Additionally, once per
session you can spend one point of Drive and a Full
Action to rummage through your belongings and pull
out a piece of equipment, costing 5 bronze pieces or
less, that would be useful in your current situation,
even if said item isn’t written on your character sheet.

64

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Gifted

Harmonic Resonance

You’re known among your kin for your extraordinary
might, cunningness, or charm.
Minor (1 BP): Increase the total value of a single Stat of
your choice by 1. Add a title, moniker, or epithet that
describe the trait your known for to your name (e.g.:
Tharos the Mighty, Illydriel the Fair, etc).
Major (3 BPs): You can also increase the total value of a
Stat of your choice (including the one you’ve already
chosen) by another 1 point.

You have a wonderful voice, gifted with perfect pitch and
a nearly magical control of it when performing.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a special +2 bonus to your any
skill rolls that involve singing or acting (Arts skill).
This gives a +1 bonus to any Influence skill rolls.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, you vocal control allows you
to perfectly mimic any sound that you have heard before,
be it a bird’s song or the commands given in a language
you have never heard before. You gain an additional +2
bonus (+4 total) to rolls involving singing or acting, and
an addition +1 bonus (+2 total) to Influence skill rolls.

Greater Fortune

You come from a wealthy family, or managed to grow in
richness and social standing with hard work… or blind luck.
Minor (1 BP): You may double the amount of starting
money that you begin with.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, you are the owner of some
land, estate or business. Describe your property and
decide where it’s located. As long as you can reach your
property, and you are looking to acquire something
that could reasonably be provided by that property, you
would only have to pay half its normal cost.

Healer’s Hands

Some heroes are known for their might in battle, but you
know that even a greater strength is required to mend what’s
broken. Yours are the hands of a healer, casting a pure light
in a world besieged by shadow.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a special +2 bonus to your
Healing skill, and a +2 bonus to your Nature and/or
Craft(Herbcraft) to find healing herbs.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, whenever you treat one of your
companions or administer them a healing herb, you may
choose one of the following options: have the patient
recover an additional number of HPs equal to your ranks
in the Healing skill times 5; grant them a special bonus to
a Save Roll made to resist the effects of a disease or poison
equal to double your number of ranks in the Healing
skill; reduce the recovery time of a treated Injury by one
day for every 5 ranks you have in the Healing skill.

Heroic Bloodline

The blood of heroes runs strongly in your veins. Tales
are sung about the mighty deeds of your family, of your
ancestors. Now these tales live again, through you.
Minor (1 BP): You can take a Half Action to inspire all
the allies that can hear you within a radius of 20 feet,
granting them a special bonus of +2 to their Will Save
Rolls, or a special +1 bonus to their Attack Bonus and
Defense for the current Round.
Major (3 BPs): You can also reveal your ancestry to
someone who doesn’t know it as a Free Action. When
you reveal yourself to someone, you can either gain
a +2 bonus to your Attack Rolls against them for the
current Round, or get to re-roll an Influence or Deceive
Roll against them with a +4 bonus.

Hammerhands

You have received training of certain special techniques
of a secretive monastic order. This required you receiving a
mark (tattoo or brand) upon your body (i.e. a dragon brand
on one forearm and a tiger brand on the other, or perhaps a
crescent moon tattoo on your left cheek).
Other initiates (and, sometimes, sworn enemies of your
faction) could recognize you from this mark, and may either
aid or hinder you, depending on the situation.
Minor (1 BP): Your unarmed attacks deal +2 damage.
This does not count towards the damage added to
Weapon Katas if you have that Special Skill.
Major (3 BP): You gain aanother +2 damage to your
unarmed attacks and special bonus of +2 to your
Defensive Modifier (DM) and also to your overall Armor
Rating (i.e. B2/S2/P2/E2). However, members of a rival
order both fear and long for your potential, and will go
to great lengths to win you over to their cause.

65

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Keeper of the Hidden Lore

Loremaster

You’re an initiate of a secret magical tradition, or part of
an arcane organization. Other initiates (and, sometimes,
sworn enemies of your faction) could recognize you, and
may either aid or hinder you, depending on the situation.
Minor (1 BP): You gain two ranks in one of your spell
skills. Treat these as Cultural Ranks.
Major (3 BPs): Your training also unlocked a previously
untapped reserve of magical power stored within you.
You gain 1 extra MP per Level (including first level).
However, the enemies of your faction both fear and
long for your potential, and will go to great lengths to
win you over to their cause.

You are a scholar, a chronicler, a sage. You spent years
studying the history of the world and are always wellinformed on anything that happens around you.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a special +1 bonus in either the
Lore or the Cultures skill. Whenever you travel to a
place you have never visited before in game, you may
ask the GM to reveal an interesting rumor, piece of lore,
or little-known historical fact about your destination.
Major (3 BPs): Choose a specific field of knowledge,
such as Dwarven history or Elvish runes. Treat all
Failure results you score in Lore or Cultures skill rolls
concerning the field of knowledge you’ve chosen as
if they were Partial Success results (Critical Failure
results are not influenced by this ability).

Lightning Reflexes

You seem to be able to process data and react more swiftly
than others that you know.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a +3 modifier to all Initiative rolls.
Major (3 BP): You gain a +3 to all Reflex Save Rolls.

Lovable Rogue

You are a scoundrel, a crook, a liar, a ne’er-do-well. By all
reasons, no one should like you, and yet people tend to find
you unexplainably charming.
Minor (1 BP): Write what makes you unreliable yet likable in
your Passions for your Nature, and increase the total value
of either your Wits or your Charisma by 1 point.
Major (3 BPs): Once per session, you can attempt to
confuse a group of sentient beings with your outrageous
behavior as a Full Action. Your targets must be able to
see and hear you, and cannot be engaged in combat
for this ability to work. Describe your act and make a
Conflicting Action Roll, using your Deceive skill against
their Perception skill. If you win, your targets are
Stunned and will be distracted by your actions until you
stop or something else catches their attention.

Linguist

You are naturally talented at learning new languages. As
such, you tend to find them easier to learn that others do.
Minor (1 BP): You gain 2 ranks in Spoken in 3 additional
languages.
Major (3 BPs): You gain 2 ranks in Reading/Writing
in the same 3 languages that you got the ranks in
Spoken for. Additionally, you gain 1 DP per level in
the Language Skill Category. This Development Point
cannot be shifted to another Skill Category.

Loyal Companion

Your companion is more than a simple animal to you. It is
your friend, your shadow; it’s part of yourself.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a loyal Small or Medium-sized
animal of your choosing, who travels with you and
follows your orders blindly.
Major (3 BPs): Your companion can be up to Large in
size, or the bond you have with your Small or Medium
sized animal is strengthened, granting you the ability
to communicate with it empathically at a basic level
(exchanging concepts like fear, joy, enemies, attack,
etc.) without speaking. You must be able to see each
other to use this ability.
Note: The companion, depending on the tier
acquired, could also be your character’s mount.

66

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Magical Affinity

Mark of Destiny

A natural talent and specialized studies made you an
expert in a particular school of magic.
Minor (1 BP): Choose one of your spells to become your
favorite. You gain a +2 bonus to all spell casting and
Arcana Rolls concerning your favorite spell.
Major (3 BPs): You gain 1 extra Mana Point per level. You also
gain a special +1 modifier to all spells that you cast, except
for the spell chosen above (which retains its +2). However,
you have a rival who’s determined to either discredit you
in the academic circles or to prove their School of Magic’s
superiority to your own Shool of Magic.

You carry a strange mark on your body, that was there
since you were born or since a very particular occasion.
Sometimes it throbs or causes you discomfort, as if to warn
you of something. You still haven’t figured out the secret it
hides, but one thing is certain: your own destiny is tightly
connected to it.
Minor (1 BP): You have a unique permanent mark
(a scar, a birthmark, a tattoo, or anything similar)
on a prominent part of your body. Describe it, then
choose one of the following: servants of a great Evil,
magic, or a specific kind of creature (demons, goblins,
undead, etc). Your mark will always warn you when
you’re in the presence of what you chose (you decide
how; it could throb, glow softly, cause you migraines,
bleed, etc). You get a -2 penalty to all Perception rolls
to notice anything else when your mark is “active”,
because of the distraction.
Major (3 BPs): You also gain an additional Passion,
named “Destiny” representing your uncommon fate.
Write it together with the GM and the rest of the group,
and remember to link it to your mark somehow (i.e.
“the blood of the ancient Archmages flows in my veins”,
or “I carry the mark of the Dragonslayer of legends”).
This Passion works exactly like the others, but cannot
be changed, unless you fulfill your destiny.

Magical Mentor

During your childhood, your parents took in a strange
old man who taught you a few tricks, that set you on your
path to your current Vocation.
The abilities listed below do not count against the Casting
Modifiers for the spell, and are applied only after the spells
have been cast.
Scope
Minor (1 BP): A single spell of your choice from those
you can normally cast has double the normal number
of targets or double its normal radius. This doubling
happens after the spell is cast.
Major (4 BP): You are able to double the radius or the
number of targets for all your spells.
Spatial
Minor (1 BP): You may select a single spell with a range
of Self or Touch. If that spell had a range of Self, you
may now cast it on others with a range of Touch. If it
had a range of Touch, it now has a 10’ range.
Major (4 BP): This range extension now applies to all
your spells that normally have a range of Self or Touch.
Subconscious Focus
Minor (1 BP): You may select one spell that requires
Concentration. It will now last for a number of rounds
after you stop concentrating equal to the number of
rounds spent contrating on it.
Major (4 BP): All of your spells that require concentation
now last for a number of rounds equal to the amount
of time you spent concentrating on it.
Temporal
Minor (1 BP): The duration of a single spell of your
choice is now doubled (i.e. 1 round per rank becomes
2 rounds per rank). This does not affect spells that
require concentration.
Major (4 BP): The duration of any spell that you cast
cast is doubled. This does not affect spells that require
concentration.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Mixed Ancestry

Elven (Grey) Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 Wits. If your base Kin is Dwarf,
Dwelf or Gnome, add 10 to base height and weight. If
your base Kin is Asgerdi, subtract 5 from base height
and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +1 bonus to Base Mana and a +1 to
anyone skill of your choice. You also have Star Sight (p.
206). Gain a +2 to Arcana, Influence, and Lore skills.
Elven (High) Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 Charisma. If your base Kin is
Dwarf, Dwelf or Gnome, add 10 to base height and
weight. If your base Kin is Asgerdi, subtract 5 from
base height and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +2 to your Base Mana. You also have
Star Sight (p. 206). Gain a +2 to Arcana, Influence,
and Lore skills.
Elven (Wood) Ancestry

One of your ancestors was not of the same Kin that you identify
as. This could mean that if you have a Major Background option
for Mixed Ancestry that one of your parents was of another
race. For the Minor Background options for Mixed Ancestry,
it could be one of your grandparents or even further back with
the Kindred Traits from this mixed ancestry just coming to the
fore in you. Any magical items that are keyed to only work for
members of a given Kin might work for you, though it is tougher
than for a full blooded member of that Kin.
There are some limitations to this however. You can only have
up to 2 Minor Ancestry Gifts or a single Major Ancestry Gift.
Just a reminder, that if you have a Major Gift, you always get the
benefits from the Minor as well.
Asgerdi Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Add 10 to the base height and 20 to the base
weight for your character when than figuring height and
weight for your character. You also gain a +1 to Brawn.
Major (3 BP): All weapons that have a length of “Longest”
are treated as Reach weapons for you. You also gain
+10 to your Base Hits as well.
Dwarf Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): You gain +1 to Stamina and a +1 to Saves
and DM against Heat and Cold attacks, and a -1 to all
Swimming attempts. If your base Kin is Dwelf or Gnome,
add 5 to base height and weight. If your base Kin is any
other race, subtract 10 from base height and weight.
Major (3 BP): You gain a +1 (+2 total) to Saves and DM
against Heat and Cold Attacks, and a -1 (-2 total) to
Swimming. You also gain +1 to Nature and Wandering
when underground. You also have Star Sight (p. 206).
Dwelf Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 to Resolve. If your base Kin is
any Kin, except Dwarf or Gnome, subtract 5 from base
height and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +1 to Stealth rolls, +2 when in shadowy
or heavily wooded locations. Gain +1 to Nature and
Wandering when foraging/
navigating in forests or similar
terrains. You also have Star
Sight (p. 206).

Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 Dexterity. If your base Kin is
Dwarf, Dwelf or Gnome, add 5 to base height and
weight. If your base Kin is Asgerdi, subtract 10 from
base height and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +1 to your Base Mana. You also
have Star Sight (p. 206). Gain a +1 to Acrobatics,
Perception and Ranged skills. You also gain a +2 to
Stealth in natural environments.
Gnome Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 to your Base Mana. If your base
Kin is any Kin, except Dwarf or Dwelf, subtract 10
from base height and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +2 your Base Mana and gain +1 to
Spellcraft rolls. You also have Star Sight (p. 206). Gain
a +1 to Ranged skill.
Human Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 to any one skill of your choice.
If your base Kin is Dwarf, Dwelf or Gnome, add 10
to base height and weight. If your base Kin is Asgerdi,
subtract 10 from base height and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +1 to any one skill of your choice
(must be different from skill listed under Minor). Gain
+1 to one Stat of your choice.
Orc Ancestry
Minor (1 BP): Gain +1 Stamina. If base Kin is Dwarf, Dwelf
or Gnome, add 10 to base height and weight. If your base
Kin is Asgerdi, subtract 10 from base height and weight.
Major (3 BP): Gain +1 to Perception skill, and +2 to
Hunting and Tracking rolls. You also gain a +3 to
Saves and DM against flame and heat. You also have
Star Sight (p. 206).

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Monastic Training

Orator

You’ve been raised and trained since you were a child in
a secluded place or monastery under the guidance of a wise
mentor, developing mystical fighting skills.
Minor (1 BP): Write your Nature about the teachings of your
master. Your unarmed attacks are one Size larger than what
they should normally be (up to a maximum of Colossal).
Major (4 BPs): Additionally, a visible, mystical aura surrounds
you when you’re in danger, granting you a special +4 bonus
to your Defensive Modifier, your Armor Ratings and your
Save Rolls if you are unarmed and aren’t wearing any torso
armor. It requires a Free Action to activate is, and you must
spend a Free Action each round to maintain it.

You love speaking to crowds and can often dway them
with the greatest of ease.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a +2 to any Influence rolls made to
sway or convince a crowd of people.
Major (4 BPs): Additionally, you get a +/-1 to Reaction
Rolls for every 5 ranks you have in the Influence skill. This
modifier may be used to help sway the reaction in the
direction that you want it to go.

Religious Adept

You are a member of an established religious order: either
of the clergy of some god’s church or some cult.
Minor (1 BP): You are an initiate adept of the cult/church.
You always carry with you a holy symbol that identifies
you as a member of your cult or church. Write your
Nature or Allegiance to reflect either your religious
creed or your loyalty to your cult/church. Other
members of the church or cult will try to help you in
times of need, giving you protection and shelter. You
also gain a special +4 bonus to all Influence and Deceive
Rolls made against other followers of your belief.
Major (3 BPs): You are a member of the clergy, a true
priest. Choose a spell of up to the 5th Tier or less that
does not require a Saving Roll, and which is related to
your beliefs. You may freely cast this spell once per day
without using Mana Points or making a casting roll.
Initiates and adepts of your cult/church will listen to
your words and obey your provisions. However, you are
disliked by the clergy and members of an opposing cult
or church.

Multi-Cultural

Your parents came from two different Cultures, or maybe you
were raised in a Culture other than the one you were born in.
Minor (1 BP): Choose a Culture other than your character’s
Culture and write a Passion about how your mixed cultural
background influenced your character’s life. Select a noncombat Skill and your character gains a+1 bonus in this
Skill, to be recorded UN the column for Culture. Then
choose one of the Culture’s Outfitting Options and add
that item to your character’s starting equipment.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, select a different Skill from
the chosen Culture and you gain a Cultural Bonus of
+2 in that skill as well.

Mundane

You’re pretty sure this is all a mistake. You’re nothing like
those great heroes of legend; you’re just an ordinary fellow. Fate,
however, works in mysterious ways, and sometimes small hands
must perform the deeds which turn the wheels of the world.
Minor (1 BP): At the end of each session, if you haven’t
spent Drive during the session, you gain a point of
Drive. This cannot allow you to exceed the maximum
of 5 Drive points.
Major (3 BPs): You gain a +6 bonus to your Save Rolls
and Defense against magic, but you also suffer a -4
penalty to your Attunement Rolls (Arcana skill) and
Spell Casting Rolls.

Rogue Mage

You were born with an innate magical ability or developed it
after a unique occurrence. You can’t really explain why or how
your magic works, but using it is as natural as breathing to you.
Minor (1 BP): Include something about your magical
ability in one of your Passions. Select any one spell of
your choosing and gain a +2 modifier for it.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, you can spend one point of
Drive to gain the ability of casting all your spells spending
no Mana Points for an entire scene. At the end of that
scene, you become Weary if you
weren’t Weary, and you drop
unconscious for 1d10 hours if
you were already
Weary. However,
you’re hunted by
a powerful NPC
because of your
powers.

Natural with Armor

You seem to have a natural facility with Armor and are
more easily able.
Minor (1 BP): Move Penalties from are halved (rounded
down), and AB Penalties are reduced by 1 point (i.e. a -2
becomes -1, etc.). Rigid armors have no minimum Move
Penalty, and can be reduced to zero via the Armor skill.
Major (3 BPs): You receive no Move Penalties from nonRigid armor. Move Penalties from Rigid armors are
reduced to one quarter (rounded up) their normal
values. Dexterity Modifiers and AB Penalties from all
armors are reduced to zero. This does not apply if the
character is wearing Layering Armor (p. 91).

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Shapechanger

Slayer

The totemic animal of your people blesses you with a
righteous fury, granting you the ability to take its shape, all the
better to crush your enemies.
Minor (2 BPs): Choose a wild animal (like a wolf, a boar, or
a mountain lion) or creature (subject to GM approval),
up to Medium in size, as the totem of your people. You
are able to transform into this animal or back to your
normal form once per day for each point of Stamina that
you have. You may also transform at will by spending a
Drive point. This transformation takes a full minute to
perform, and your equipment and clothing do not change
with you. Any clothing or armor worn while changing
is destroyed. While in your normal form, should you
become Bruised, you will change involuntarily if you fail
a Will Save Roll against your own level.
Upon changing, you are required to make a Will Save
Roll against the level of the animal or creature that you
transform into. Should you succeed, you receive a -4 to all
mentally based skills due to your more feral state. Should
you fail the Save, you receive a -10 to all mentally based
skills and are in a completely frenzied state, referred to
as Bestial Fury, attacking those nearest you, even if they
are friends, should you fail a Perception roll and thus not
recognize them as such.
You revert to your normal form if you are
Incapacitated or you succeed at a Perception roll and
there are no enemies left while controlled by Bestial
Fury. If not controlled by Bestial Fury, you may return
to your normal self at any time.
While in your alternate form, you have the AR, DM,
and natural physical abilities and attack types of that
form. When making attacks, you can use either your
Brawl skill bonus with a +2 modifier, or the alternative
form’s attack bonuses, whichever is higher. Perception
will use either the alternate form’s Roguery skill or
your Perception skill (with a +2 modifier), whichever is
higher. You are not able to speak or cast spells while in
your alternate form.
For every 3 levels that you have (3, 6, 9, etc.), your
alternate form gains +1 level, up to double its starting level.
Each level grants a +2 to skills (including attacks) and
Saves; and +10 to Hit Points; it also grants a +1 to DM.
Major (4 BPs): You may choose a Large animal/creature as
your totem instead of a Medium-sized one. Changing
forms only requires 3 Full Actions (3 rounds), and your
clothing and equipment will simply fall to the ground
beside you (you do not have to remove them first).
You also no longer need to make a Will Save to avoid
Bestial Fury when changing voluntarily. Spending a
Drive point to change forms allows you to do so as a
single Full Action.

You have sworn an oath of eternal enmity towards a
particular enemy. You have spent a great part of your life
studying them, to find better ways to hunt them.
Minor (1 BP): Pick a specific type of creature (like dragons,
kobolds, goblins, duergars, trolls, etc.) as your hated
enemy, and write one of your Passions about your hatred
toward them. You gain a +2 bonus to your skill rolls for
Hunting, Cultures, and Lore, plus you also gain this bonus
on all Attack rolls when your hated enemy is involved,
even if you are not directly fighting your hated enemy.
You cannot choose the Kin of one of your companions as
your hated enemy.
Major (3 BP): Additionally, whenever you start a combat
against your hated enemy or defeat one of your hated
enemies in a fight, you gain one Hatred Token (use a glass
bead or similar marker to represent it). You can spend a
Hatred Token either to re-roll an Attack Roll that targeted
a hated enemy or to add 3 Success Levels to the number
you gain in any attack against a hated enemy (the attack
must be at least a Partial Success). Unused Hatred Tokens
are discarded at the end of each combat.

Stormcrow

You are cursed with a peculiar ability. You see glimpses
of the future, now and then, but your visions only show you
sorrow, failure, pain, and death. Your associates rarely listen
to your counsel, calling you a doomsayer and a bird of illomen. But you know what’s coming and prepare for the worst.
Minor (1 BP): Write one of your Passions about your
visions, and increase the total value of your Insight
by 1 point.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, whenever one of your allies
spends a point of Drive to re-roll a failed Skill or Save
Roll and fails again, you may spend a Free Action
to have a vision of doom. When you do so, your
companion may accept the failure and get the point of
Drive they just spent back.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Strange Wyrd

Trader

You are bound by a strange fate. Improbable and
unpredictable things seems to happen with alarming
frequency around you, for good or bad.
Minor (1 BP): The range of open-ended rolls is increased
by one. You open-end on unmodified rolls of 18 to 20
on the high side. You also automatically have a Critical
Failure on an unmodified roll 2 or 3.
Major (3 BPs): Your range for open-ended rolls is now an
unmodified 17 to 20 on the dice. You also automatically
receive a Critical Failure on an unmodified roll of 4 or
less on any dice rolls. If your Critical Failure range is
modified for any other reason, those modifiers start at
your new range and go from there.

You are or were in the trading business, as a member of
a great merchant family, a shrewd dealer of rare goods, a
provider of specialized services, or a similar occupation.
Minor (1 BP): You get a special +2 bonus to your Deceive
and Influence Rolls whenever you’re closing a deal or
bargaining for something.
Major (3 BP): Additionally, once per session, when you
meet a new NPC, you may spend one point of Drive to
declare that they are either an old customer of yours,
or a fellow trader.

Treasure Hunter

You are trained as a professional treasure-hunter. Your
services are usually sought by those who’d like to acquire
precious (and often carefully guarded) items with a certain
amount of discretion.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a +1 bonus in Stealth and
Gimmickry and a +2 bonus in Appraisal. Additionally,
you can always eyeball the approximate value, within
25%, of any precious item you see, even with a single
glance (no roll required).
Major (3 BPs): Moreover, whenever you attack an
opponent bare-handed or using a Hand weapon, you
may use a Free Action to make a Stealth Roll. If you
succeed, you may pilfer a non-fixed small item within
your reach, as long as no one is holding or wielding
it. However, you’ve stolen something from someone,
and now, if they realize that you took it, they will be
hunting you to get it back.

Strider

You lived most of your life in the wilderness, and are
accustomed to the laws of Nature. You are stigmatized as an
“outsider” by most of the civilized people you meet, but you
probably don’t care.
Minor (1 BP): Write your Nature about why you
preferred the harshness of the wilds to the comforts
of civilization. You gain a +2 bonus to all of your
Adventuring Skills while you are outdoors, away from
civilization. Furthermore, you can travel up to 1.5x the
normal overland distance per day, as long as you’re on
foot and Unencumbered or Lightly Encumbered.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, you get a +6 bonus on your
Save Rolls against Weariness and Starvation, and a +4
bonus to your Stealth and Perception Skills while you
are out in the wilderness.

Sworn Defender

You are or were part of an elite military order sworn to
protect something. It could be a place, an item, a person, or
even an ideal, such as justice or honor. Whatever it is, you
have vowed to defend it even at the cost of your own life,
regardless of whether you still belong to the order or not.
Minor (1 BP): Write your Allegiance about your order and
its mission. You gain one rank in both Armor and Body.
You also get a special +2 bonus to your Influence skill
rolls against people who are either part of what your
order protects or friendly to their cause.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, you are immune to fear
and gain a +3 bonus to your Save Rolls against mindinfluencing effects.

Unbreakable Bond

The road may be dark before you, but you’re not alone to
face it. You formed a strong bond with another member of
your fellowship. Together, you can overcome any adversity.
Minor (1 BP): Select one of your companions and write
your Allegiance about them. You gain a +2 bonus to
any rolls made to Help the chosen character. Moreover,
you always know when your chosen companion is in
danger, even if you aren’t able to see each other or are
separated by a great distance.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, as long as you and the
chosen companion are within sight of each other, both
of you gain a +1 bonus to your DM and Save Rolls.

Tough Skin

You had something happen to you in your past, and now
your very skin is resistant to damage of all types.
Minor (1 BP): You get a special +1 to all aspects of your
natural Armor Rating, except for SL reduction.
Major (3 BP): You gain an SL reduction of 1, and all other
aspects of your natural AR is increased to equal your
Stamina stat or 3, whichever is higher.
71

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Underground Upbringing

Unusual Training

You spent your youth in the company of thieves, ruffians, or
others criminals. You may have left those years behind you, but
you have never completely severed your ties with the underworld.
Minor (1 BP): Write something about your relationship
with your criminal contacts in your Allegiance. You can
use your network of contacts to call in favors or get better
prices in the black market. Whenever you’re buying stolen
or illegal goods, you gain a +2 to any involved rolls.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, once per session whenever
you are in a town, city, or other civilized settlement,
you may spend one point of Drive to declare that you
have a contact in the local criminal underworld that
might help you in the situation at hand. Name the NPC
introduced this way. They must actually lend you some
kind of help to solve the specified situation but, besides
that, they’re controlled by the GM like any other NPC
and aren’t forced to help you for free (they’re criminals,
after all).

You helped out a wanderer and later befriended him. In
return for this help, he stuck around for a while and taught a few
skills that you might not have learned otherwise.
You should come up with some details on who the
wanderer and tie it into one of your Passions. It need not
become one of the Passions, but it should be related to at
least one of them.
This Background is one where both Minor and Major
may be taken once each, allowing for a total of 3 Special
Skills to be learned overall.
Minor (1 BP): You learn a Special Skill, one not available
through your normal Vocational Kits.
Major (3 BPs): You learn one additional Special Skill (2
in total, with the one gained from Minor included).
Work out how the two are related to each other. How
they are related should be part of the backstory for this
Background Option.

Vigilant

Unmagical

An adventurous life taught you to sleep lightly and be
always ready for trouble.
Minor (1 BP): Four hours of rest are enough to give you
the benefits of a full night of sleep. This doesn’t change
your HPs recovery rate, but allows you to recover from
the Weary condition and regain all spent MPs with 4
hours of rest.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, you can take Full Actions,
attack, and Parry normally when you are Surprised.
You are still considered Surprised for the purpose
of resolving your foe’s attacks and special abilities.
However, there’s a reason why you’re always watchful.
Someone or something is out there to get you. Name
your enemy and write an Allegiance about them.

When young, you had a bad experience with magic, so much
so that it you have an unnatural resistance to magic of all types.
Minor (1 BP): You gain a +2 saves against all types of
magic. You must even make Saves against spells that
you may want cast upon you. You also cannot use any
items that have spell or spell-like abilities, though you
may use items with constant bonuses (i.e. a +1 sword).
Major (3 BP): Your bonus against magic is increased
from +2 to +5.

Unorthodox Education

Well Traveled

You started learning the ropes of a different Vocation than the
one you belong to now, but either soon discovered that it wasn’t
your calling or were somehow forced to interrupt your training.
Minor (1 BP): Choose a Skill in which you have no
Vocational Ranks. You gain a special +2 bonus (not
ranks) to that Skill.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, subtract 1 DP per level
from one Skill Category and apply it to another Skill
Category (excluding Languages) of your choice.
However, you gained the enmity of a powerful
individual during your training. Name your enemy
and write your Allegiance about them. For example,
if you are a Wizard and chose to move one DP from
Knowledge to Combat, reducing how many you get
each level in Knowledge, but increasing how many you
get each level in Combat.

You travelled far and wide, and are familiar with many
places and ways unknown to the majority of people.
Minor (1 BP): You gain one rank in Wandering and you
know the location of a Safe Haven. Once during the
game, unless your character is in territory controlled
by a great Evil, you can declare that a Safe Haven is
near, and mark it on the map within 1d5 (1d10, divided
by 2, rounded up) days of travel from your character’s
position. Once you’ve done this, you lose this ability,
but the Safe Haven remains available to you and your
companions.
Major (3 BPs): Additionally, once per session when your
party is Preparing for Travel, you may ask the GM to
reveal an alternative, secret, or rarely used route to
your destination, without any Skill Roll.

Drawbacks

Drawbacks
Animal Mark
Animal Spook
Bleeder

Bloodlust
Chivalrous
Cold Skin
