239

350 lbs, 5-10 young, Encountered: 1-10; Greater: Sz:
Huge, 9’-11’ long, 600-900 lbs, 5-10 young, Encountered
(wild): 1-10
Giant Spiders come in two main varieties, Lesser and
Greater. Some scholars theorize that they are actually the
same type of spider, just that the Lesser are much much
younger than the Greater. This has yet to be proven.
They are, however, deadly predators. They will spin
their webs in areas where they can find food. Some
may lair in caves, and have webs spun in nearby forests,
while others will lair in the forests themselves, in a nest
that they have built near their nests. To be clear, the
spider does not lair in its web, but retreats to its nest for
sleeping and sometimes eating prey captured elsewhere.
Giant Spiders use their poison to great effect. Depending
upon the spider, they will have one of two types of poison.
The first is a paralytic. For Lesser Spiders, this paralytic
poison has a level of 2, while it has a level of 4 for Greater
Spiders. In either case, failure on the Save means that the
target is paralyzed for 1 minute for each point that they
failed their Save by. The other type of poison is level 6
and it is only found in Greater Spider, and its effects are
described below, should the target fail their Save.
Regardless of the type of poison a spider carries, once
a target has been affected, so long as there are no other
threats present, the spider will start concooning the prey in
a strong silky material, that is highly prized by those who
craft clothing. Once concooned, they are then dragged off
to the spider’s lair and suspended until the spider is ready
for its dinner.

incapacitated and lapses into a coma for 1-100 days.

16+

and he dies in 1-10 hours of incapacitating pain.

Swamp Octopus — Sz: Huge, 3’-4’ long, 60-140 lbs, 1-2

Wasp, Giant — Sz: Medium, 5’-6’ long, 10’ wingspan,

15-30 lbs, 1-10 young, Encountered: 1-2 outside nest,
2-20 in nest
Wasps are scary when they are normal sized, due
to their temperment and willingness to attack almost
anybody when they are ticked off. Giant Wasps are
downright terrifying!
These creatures are
usually solitary hunters,
finding prey and bringing it
back to the hive and to the
queen wasp.
They attack with their
knife-edged mandibles.
They only use their
stingers as a weapon of
last resort.
This sting delivers a 3rd
level poison that paralyzes
the limb or body part
attacked for 1 minute for
every point that the target
has failed their Save by.
Giant Wasps do not eat only
meat, they also supplement
their diets with plant matter.
The nest of a hive of Giant Wasps looks like a huge
mound of mud or clay and there is usually at least one
Giant Wasp outside of the hive entrance at all times.

young, Capacity: 180 lbs, Encountered (wild): 5-30 3’-5’
long body, 10’-15’ long tentacles, 100-200 lbs, 2-3 young,
Encountered: 1-2
Swamp Octopi resemble their oceanic counterparts,
but tend to be much larger than those normally found in
the seas. Their coloration ranges from muddy browns
and grays to dull greens and black. This allows them to
blend into their surroundings much better.
Swamp Octopi use their coloration to great effect
by lying motionless for long periods of time, until prey
wanders within its reach. It will then grapple the prey
with its tentacles, and drag it to it mouth where its
sharp beak (pincer attack) can tear it to shreds.
While it normally hunts fish, birds, small mammals,
lizards and amphibians, scholars believe that it will
usually not attack anything larger than a medium
sized dog unless its home or young are threatened.

Syris (Riding Cat) — Sz: Large, 4’-7’ long, 200-700 lbs, 1-4

young, Capacity: 175 lbs, Encountered (wild): 2-10
Built along the same lines as a tiger, the Syris has a
striking brown and green coat patterned much the same
as a tiger’s coat. They can be trained as mounts if caught
young. They are extremely rare as the kit’s parents are
fiercely protective. This protectiveness also means that
once a Syris has bonded to a rider, it will never be able to
be used for another rider without magical help. Syris are
found exclusively in dark, thick forests, such as Duinn
Weald in Tir Tuatha or the Canga Vytr of Tir Caledi.

Tarq (Riding Goat) — Sz: Medium, 3’-4’ long, 60-140 lbs,

Wolf — Sz: Medium, 3’-5’ long, 75-200 lbs, 3-5 young,

1-2 young, Capacity: 180 lbs, Encountered (wild): 5-30
The Tarq is strongly related to goats. However, they
are stronger, tougher, and have a lot more endurance
then the average goat. Because of this, and because of
their ability to eat almost anything, they make excellent
mounts for the smaller Kins. Both the Ethori Gnomes,
and the Aeshi use these creatures as mounts.

240

Encountered: 2-20
Wolves are large canines, from 1 to 1.5 meters (3 to
5 feet) in length, weighing anywhere from 50 to 150
pounds normally.
They have thick, wiry fur, ranging in color from
gray to brown or even black. Their undercoat is often
a slightly lighter shade.
Wolves can hunt alone or in packs, and the pack can
range widely in its hunt for food. Wolves are fiercely
territorial and will often gather together to bring down
larger prey or creatures that might invade its territory.

Elementals

There are many different Upper Planes (p. 187), often
going by various name such as Arcadia, Elysium, the Happy
Hunting Grounds, Nirvana, the Seven Heavens, Paradise
and many more. Some scholars believe that each of these
are separate collections of planes within the Upper Planes,
while others believe that they are simply different names
for a single collection of planes. In either case, these planes
are collectively known as the Celestial Planes, and they
are forever at war with the denizens of the Infernal Planes
(demons, devils, and undead).
We also include the Elemental Planes and the Spirit Planes
along with these Celestial Planes since they also tend to
oppose those from the Infernal Planes.
Those from the Celestial Planes, excluding Elementals
and Spirits, are collectively known as Celestials.
It would be a mistake to think that the Celestials are
benign or always beneficial. They have been at war for ages
and can be cruel in their own ways.
Celestials are creatures, spirits and beings from other
planes. The few we provide here are meant to give a basic
idea of those encountered most frequently. All those known
as Celestials share a few common abilities, like the following:
•• Circle of Light: 1x per day for each level that they have,
they are the focal point for an aura of light that has
a radius equal to 1’ for each level that they have. This
light will last for 10 minutes each time that they use it;
•• Dark Sight: All Celestials have Dark Sight at double the
ranges given on p. 206;
•• Immune to Summoning Circles: Celestials cannot be
confined within a Summoning Circle;
•• Detect Magic: All Celestials are able to see what is
magical within 30’ plus 5’ per level that they have;
•• Poison Immunity: Immune to venoms and poisons;
•• Immune to non-magical weapons: Damage from such
weapons heals almost instantly;
•• Speak in Tongues: Celestials are able to speak any language.
•• Of Smiting: all attacks do double damage and double
SL against Infernals

Balaha — Sz: Huge, 9’-10’ long, 1,500-2,000 lbs, Capacity:

750 lbs Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard Celestial
abilities, Balaha also have the following:
•• Divine Aura: Balaha gain a +4 to all rolls or defenses
against any Infernal attack or ability.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will transport the
summoner to any one location, or serve as a mount for
up to 72 hours.
The kings of horses, the Balaha are somewhat
larger than a heavy horse or war horse and superior
in all ways. As a winged, flying horse, some scholars
have suggested that they are responsible for the pegasi
through mating with normal horses.
Balaha are always a silvery white in color and have
wingspans of up to 50 feet. Their hooves appear golden
in color, and strike sparks when travelling against hard
surfaces such as rocks.

Eloihym — Sz: Medium, 4’-5’ tall, 125-180 lbs, 8’ wingspan,

241

Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard Celestial
abilities, Eloihym also have the following:
•• Divine Aura: Eloihym gain a +4 to all rolls or defenses
against any Infernal attack or ability.
•• Regeneration: 3 Hits per minute
•• Spells: May cast any Tier of Divinism spell up to their level,
no mana cost
•• True Sight: The Eloihym are able to discern lies, and see the
true form of those who have shifted form or are diguised in
any manner, and they see through all illusions.
Services Rendered: when summoned, Eloihym will answer
any one question fully and honestly about any mortal topic
These small beings have golden skin, and blonde
hair. Their feathered wings are pearly white and their
eye are black and look to be filled with stars.
The Eloihym often serve as truthsayers for the other
beings who serve the higher powers.

Ishym — Sz: Tiny, 1’-2’ tall, 5-10 lbs, 2’-3’ wingspan

Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard Celestial
abilities, Ishym also have the following:
•• Divine Aura: Ishim gain a +2 to all rolls or defenses
against any Infernal attack or ability.
•• Regeneration: 1 Hit per minute
•• Spells: May cast any Tier of Divinism spell up to their level,
no mana cost
•• Invisibility: Ishym are able to turn invisible at will,
although they cannot maintain it while attacking.
Services Rendered: when summoned, may speak one
prophesy or make one prediction about the future, or will
deliver a message to one person.
Standing slightly over a foot tall on average, the
largest Ishym ever encountered was still shorter than 2
feet in height. They have golden skin, and pearly white
wings, but their hair is always raven black. Their eyes
are also black and appear to be filled with stars.

Kerubs — Sz: Tiny, 2’-3’ tall, 20-30 lbs, 2’-3’ wingspan,

Encountered: 1

•• Divine Aura: Kerubs gain a +3 to all rolls or defenses
against any Infernal attack or ability.
•• Regeneration: 2 Hits per minute
•• Spells: May cast any Tier of Divinism spell up to their level,
no mana cost
Services Rendered: when summoned, may provide a
blessing, granting a +1 to all rolls for 24 hours.
Kerubs appear as small winged children, a bit
pudgy, but not fat. Their black, star-filled eyes and
golden skin, taken with their small, pearly white wings
give them an unnatural air. Their blonde hair shines
with a silvery glint. They often carry a type of Parrying
Dagger known as a Sykir.
Kerubs often act as messengers and envoys for the
more powerful Celestial beings.

Malakym — Sz: Large, 6’-7’ long, 200-250 lbs, 15’-20’

wingspan, Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard Celestial
abilities, Malakym also have the following:
•• Divine Aura: Malakym gain a +6 to all rolls or defenses
against any Infernal attack or ability.
•• Regeneration: 5 Hits per minute
•• Spells: May cast any Tier of Divinism spell up to their level,
no mana cost
•• Teleport: May teleport at will to any destination, and
take along 1 additional person or creature per level that
they have.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will guard any
one place or individual for up to 72 hours.

Malakym are the largest and most powerful of the
lowest Order of Celestials. They have golden skin, and
silver hair to go along with their pearly white wings.
They are warriors wearing white robes and wielding
glowing swords in the service of their patrons.

~Elementals~
Elementals are beings from one of the various elemental
planes that populate the Upper Planes. There are 7 primary
elemental planes and several different types of beings in
each plane. We provide the two most common
Air: This element is gaseous and constantly moving. It
attacks using impacts and electricity. Air is opposed by
Earth and Ice.
Dark: This is more than the absence of light, it is also
cold and represents a lack of energy or movement,
of absorption. It attacks using cold and reductions in
movement. Dark is opposed by Fire and Light.
Earth: This element represents solidity and the permanent
nature of stone. It atacks using bashing attacks, or
piercing attacks, depending upon the shape that the
attack takes. Earth is opposed by Water and Air, the
elements of erosion.
Fire: Fire is an energetic element, full of heat and motion.
It attacks using heat, and by igniting flammable
materials. Fire is opposed by Earth and Water.
Ice: Ice is the element of stasis and the solidity that comes
from not moving. It attacks usingle cold, bashing and
piercing damage, depending upon the shape that the
attack takes. Ice is opposed by Fire and Water.
Light: This element is all about radiant energy. It attacks
using piercing beams of heat, cauterizing wounds that it
makes, so it rarely does bleeding damage. Light is opposed
by Dark and Earth, both of which block its radiance.
Water: This element is fluid and constantly moving and
changing and adapting to the shape of its container.
It changes all that it interacts with. It attacks using
bashing attacks. Water is opposed by Earth and Fire.
Elemental Abilities: All Elemental creatures share a few
common abilities as listed below:
•• Energizing: Elementals are energized and healed
by elemental attacks fo their own element.
•• Susceptibility: Elementals take double damage and
double SL from attacks by their opposing elements.

242

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Elemental Wisps — Sz: Miniscule, 6”-12” ball of

elemental material, Encountered: 1
Wisps are the weakest of elemental creatures. They
are also the easiest to summon and control. In fact,
unless a Wisp is being tightly controlled, they will
avoid combat if at all possible.
Wisps appear as a small, easily visible ball of their
elemental material that floats or flies at all times.
However, they have no apendages and cannot carry
more than 2-3 lbs of weight, and that weight must be
able to be encapsulated by the elemental’s body.
Wisps attack by running into their targets, the
actual type of elemental damage determined by the
element that they are comprised of.

Minor Elemental — Sz: Medium, 3’-4’ tall, comprised

of elemental matieral, Encountered: 1
Minor Elementals have vaguely humanoid shapes
comprised of their given element in a flexible format. For
example, Earth elementals look like soft loam or dirt, while
Ice elementals look like they are made from snow.
They attack by striking with what passes for their fists,
doing a combination of both bashing and elemental damage.
They are also able to shoot a bolt of their elemental material
at a target. Some elementals may have more than one type of
attack. For example, Earth elementals could shoot stones or
sharp shards of rock, while Ice elementals do the same with
chunks of ice or sharp icicles. Light elementals shoot a beam
of focused light that does both piercing and heat damage,
often inadvertantly cauterizing the would so that it does not
bleed afterwards.
While Minor Elementals are harder to control, they are
also more intelligent and can be relied upon doing as they
are commanded, even fighting if needing to.

Spirit Entities can easily traverse from the mortal planes to
any of the Spirit Planes at will, only taking physical form on the
mortal planes. The form taken is determined by the type of spirit
that they are. All spirit entities have the following in common:
•• Immunity: cannot be damaged by non-magical weapons
•• Immunity: Immune to influence or control spells,
except for those related to summoning or related to
them specifically.
•• Intangibility: Able to turn non-corporeal or solid at will.
Transformation from one state to another is accomplished
as a Free Action, but this transition may only be performed
once per round.
•• Plane Shift: Spirits can move freely between the
mortal plane and the Lower Astral. The transition can
be performed as a Free Action, but may only be done
once per round.

Familiar Spirits — Sz: Miniscle - Medium, Encountered:

~Spirits~
In the center of all is the material plane from which can
be reached the Inner Planes, such as the Ethereal, the Lower
Astral and the Upper Astral. From the Upper Astral, we can
reach the Outer Planes, specifically the Lower or Infernal
Planes, from which comes Demons, Devils and Undead,
and the Upper Planes, which includes the Elemental Planes
and other higher planes such as those populated by lesser
deities and above them, the higher deities.
Among the Astral Planes dwell a variety of Spirits,
sometimes called Spirit Entities. These Spirit Entities may
call the Astral their home, but it is more likely that they
come originally from some of the Upper Planes, drawn
closer to the material planes by curiosity.
On these planes, Spirit Entities appear as geometric
shapes, pulsing with an inner light, this is often referred to
as its “body of light”. Those with the proper lore can easily
discern one type of spirit from another when viewing them
in their body of light.

243

1 (and only when attached to a spell user)
A Familiar Spirit is a minor spirit entity that can be
summoned by a spell caster to become his familiar. The
Familiar Spirit generally has a neutral outlook, tending
to adopt the views and moral and ethical standards of
the spell caster that it is bonded to and serves.
Like all other spirits, on their home planes, Familiar
Spirits have only their body of light. When summoned to
the mortal plane, the Familiar Spirit must take on a mortal
form. The physical form that it takes appears to be random
and once taken, it can take no other physical form. While
these physical forms resemble normal animals, they are
still just a spirit made manifest, and as such they share a
number of characteristics, regardless of their form.
It is conjectured that the Familiar Spirit patterns its
form after a nearby example, but this is unproven. What is
known is that sometimes, a Familiar Spirit is unable to take
its own physical form. These are known as Disembodied
Spirits (see below). A Familiar Spirit’s physical form is
usually the same as a normal animal of a given type, unless
noted otherwise.
Familiar Spirits are as intelligent as small children
and able to mentally communicate with their masters
at a distance of up to 1 mile. They have all of the
abilities that are common to Spirits in general.
If a spell caster is unhappy with his Familiar Spirit,
he may freely dismiss it, and it will then return home.
However, once dismissed, the caster must wait at least
a year and a day before attempting to summon another
Familiar Spirit.
Here is a listing of some of the forms that Familiar
Spirits may take, along with some other information
regarding the specific forms.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Disembodied Spirits – These are Familiar Spirits that
have no physical form. They will often inhabit some
non-magical object or device owned by the caster who
summoned them. Some Disembodied Spirits have been
known to inhabit cauldrons, amulets, crystal balls,
mirrors, empty skulls and even more unusual objects.
Disembodied Spirits have 3 main abilities. First is the
ability to predict the future once per week. However,
they can be very uncooperative if asked to do this more
than once a month. These Spirits may also, once per
week, answer a simple yes or no question (i.e. “Am I the
fairest in the land”), but its answer will often be verbose
and couched in rhyme. Finally, the Disembodied Spirit
may use its vessel to scry for its master, showing him a
person or place that the master wishes.
Disembodied Spirits also have a tendency to go insane
after a period of time, and this often results in them
misbehaving badly, singing (off-key), telling bad jokes,
insulting everybody, and occasionally even refusing
to obey their master. Unlike other Familiar Spirits,
Disembodied Spirits cannot simply be dismissed. They
must, instead, be banished by way of a spell.
Note: GMs should remember that the Disembodied
Spirit only tells the most probable future and that
the telling of it likely changes the circumstances
and can prevent it from happening.
Ant, Giant – The Familiar grants its bonded spell caster a
+2 modifier Helping (p. 116) others. It also grants a +2
modifier to all Athletics skill rolls.
Bat – Bat Familiars can navigate in total, even magical,
darkness using their sonar and relay descriptions of
such areas to their bonded spell caster. They also grant
their bonded spell caster a +4 bonus to all attempts to
recognize and see through illusions.
Bee, Giant – The Giant Bee Familiar is about 6-8” in length.
It grants its bonded spell caster a +2 bonus on all Will
Saves and any other task that requires concentration.
Butterfly, Giant – Familiar Spirits who take the form of
Butterflies always take a form similar to that of the
Birdwing Butterfly. These have bodies that are from 4”-5”
in length and a 12”-14” wingspan. Giant Butterflies grant
their bonded spell casters a bonus of +2 to all Healing
skill rolls. Additionally, any spells, items, or effects that
transform or change the caster’s physical form in some
manner have double the normal duration.
Cat – This is the form of a normal house cat. Cats come with
many different colors and patterns on their fur. A Cat
familiar will grant its bonded spell caster a +2 to both his
Stealth skill rolls and to any Perception rolls.
Chameleon – The Chameleon is a small reptile, about 6”-8”
in length. The Chameleon grants its bonded spell caster
with a +2 modifier to Stealth and to all artistic (painting,
sculpting, etc.) endeavors.

244

Fox – Familiar Spirits that take the form of a Fox grant its
bonded spell caster a +2 bonus to all Spellcraft rolls and
Saves versus spells.
Goat – Goat Familiars grant its bonded spell caster a +2
modifier to all Toughness Saves and Athletics and/or
Acrobatics skill rolls.
Hound – Hounds grant their bonded spell caster a +2
modifier to all Perception and Tracking rolls.
Lizard – Familiar Spirits who have taken the form of the
Lizards are from 10”-24” in length, including their tails.
Lizards grant their bonded spell casters a +2 bonus to all
Perception and Healing skill rolls.
Owl – Owl Familiars grant their bonded spell casters a
+2 modifier on any Perception rolls and they are never
subjected to the Condition known as Surprised, even if
they lose the Conflicting Action roll.
Raccoon – Familiar Spirits in the form of a Raccoon grant
their bonded spell caster a +2 bonus on all Gimmickry,
Thieving and Trickery skill rolls.
Rat – Those Familiar Spirits who take the form of the Rats
grant their bonded spell casters a +2 bonus to all Saves
against fear, regardless of the source. Additionally, the
bonded spell caster is also granted a +2 to Perception
rolls, +3 if the roll involves smell.
Raven – In Raven form, Familiar Spirits grant their bonded
spell casters a +2 modifier to Will Saves and to Spellcraft,
Arcana, and Alkemics rolls.
Spider – Familiar Spiders have a body that is about 5”-6”
in length, giving them about a 10 to 14 inch leg span.
Spiders grant their bonded spell casters a +2 modifier to
Perception rolls and to any rolls versus illusions.
Squirrel – Familiar Spirits that take the form of Squirrels
grant their bonded spell casters a +2 to their Perception
rolls, and a very unique ability. Three times a day, the
bonded spell caster may activate this ability to gain
an extra Half Action with no negative modifier in the
round after activation.
Weasel – Familiar Spirits who take the form of a Weasel
provide their bonded spell caster with a +2 modifier
to Perception rolls and any non-attack skill roles
requiring dexterity.
Wolf – In Wolf form, the Familiar Spirit grant their
bonded spell casters a +2 modifier to Will Saves and to
Perception rolls.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Nature Spirits (Wildlings) — Sz: Miniscule, 12”-18”

tall, 5-10 lbs, Encountered: 1 or 2-20
Some scholars believe that some Nature Spirits are
related to the Elementals because of how several types
of them seem to have elemental associations, but they
are not Elemental creatures, they are spirits.
Nature Spirits are often called Wildlings, or more
rarely Wild Folk. Though Nature Spirits are normally
invisible to the naked eye, they exist throughout the
natural world and are known to inhabit all types of
organic and inorganic substances. They may only be
seen by those who summon them, or those who have
the Gift, Second Sight (p. 58) or through a spell that
allows one to see invisible creatures and beings.
There are five types of Nature Spirits. When on the
mortal plane they appear as tiny humanoids, often
resembling their elemental substance. Nature Spirits
are usually only summoned by Shamans or Druids. If
summoned, they can be asked to perform a single small
service, but only if the service in question is of a short
duration, usually one hour or less.
Nature Spirits can only affect the material world in
the most minor of ways. They may lift or carry small or
tiny items that are less than 1 pound in weight, and they
may pinch or scratch foes. This form of attack only does
1 point of damage plus 1 point per Success Level gained in
their attack (no other SL options allowed). It also ignores
all AR from armor.
And since Nature Spirits are, in fact, spirits, they are also
immune to non-magical attacks and to all types of control
spells that are not associated with them specifically.
Nature Spirits may also, rarely, be called upon to serve
as Familiars. However, they will never serve anybody who
is evil, and they consider the spell caster who summons
them as their friend, not their master. Unlike Familiar
Spirits, a Nature Spirit can choose to dissolve the Familiar
bond as well. If bonded as a Familiar, a Nature Spirit will
be able to communicate telepathically with their “friend”
for a distance of up to one mile, and they will be able to
hear their friend call (in a mundane fashion, not through
a spell) for them even if they are upon the Astral Plane.
Each type of Nature Spirit also has unique abilities
associated with its form. They are as follows:
Air (Wind) Spirits: These tiny figures have light blue skin
and diaphanous wings and wispy white hair. They hear
everything that transpires within their domain and if
summoned, they may be asked up to three questions
regarding any such knowledge that they might possess.
As a Familiar, the Wind Spirit may be asked to carry any
conversation that it personally hears (i.e. is present for) to
its master. Also, the Wind Spirits can also produce a bubble
of fresh air around the head of its friend that will last for up
to one hour (this can be done once per day). Wind Spirits
can be found anywhere that the wind blows, but they will
never enter any man-made structures or structures that
even appear to be semi-enclosed unless they are a Familiar.
245

Earth Spirits: These bald little spirits usually take the color
of the earth, clay, sand, or rock in which they reside.
They know of every creature that crawls, walks, slithers,
or tunnels through their domains and if summoned,
may be asked up to three questions concerning this
knowledge. Earth Spirits, unlike Air Spirits, have little
care for what such creatures might have to say, but they
are very observant about what transpires within their
domains. Earth Spirits may be found in any sort of earth
or stone. As a Familiar, the Earth Spirit may temporarily
impart the “Strength of the Earth” to his friend up to 3
times a day. This manifests as either a +5 Brawn bonus
or 5 points of AR (all except SL) against all attacks. This
ability will only last for 5 rounds each time the Earth
Spirit grants it to his friend.
Fire Spirits: These small spirits are bright red in color and
have reddish-blonde hair that waves above their heads as
if it were a flame. These spirits may be asked to ignite any
combustible materials within 100’ of the spot to which
they are summoned. They are only able to kindle small
fires; however, if there is enough material, these fires may
spread naturally. Conversely, the Fire Spirit may ignite or
douse any or all light sources (torches, candles, fireplace
hearths, etc.) with a 20’ radius. Fire Spirits love to cavort
in any type of open flame and can often be found in them,
or in any volcanic region. As a Familiar, the Fire Spirit
can reduce any damage from fire that his friend takes by
5 points per instance. This is treated as a constant 5 points
of AR against fire and heat based attacks.
Water Spirits: Water Spirits have deep blue skin and long,
green hair that resembles the leaves of aquatic plants.
They know all that transpires within the body of water
in which they reside and they may be asked to locate or
retrieve items lost within their domain. Water Spirits may
be found in any body of water, from puddles to streams
and pools, to rivers and fountains, and lakes and even
oceans. Water Spirits may also produce up to 1 pint of
fresh, clear water. This can only be done once per hour.
As a Familiar, the Water Spirit may grant his friend the
ability to breathe underwater for up to 1 hour per day.
Wood Spirits: These small spirits have rough brown skin that
is much like the bark of a tree and their hair is green
and resembles leaves. Wood Spirits have the ability to
make any plant or tree grow to its full size in the space
of an hour. They may, alternatively, cause any type of
fruit bearing tree or shrub to produce fully ripened
fruit (over the course of an hour) in any season except
for winter. Wood Spirits may be found in all types of
plants, trees, herbs, or even grasses. When serving as a
Familiar, the Wood Spirit can easily lead his friend to
the nearest source any type of plant or tree (such as a
fruit tree, a berry bush, or a specific non-magical herb)
or warn him of dangerous plants or terrain within the
nearby area (within 100’).

Constructs — Sz: Medium, Minor: 4’-8’ in size; Major:

Sz: Large, 9’-15’ in size; Encountered: 1
Constructs are creatures created from many
component parts, which are assembled and then
animated. An animated suit of armor is just as much as
construct as is a scarecrow that gaurds a field. As such,
they often have built in weaponry of some sort. Minor
Constructs have no intelligence, only a single mission
which they are tasked to perform. Major Constructs are
often intelligent to some degree, and have more options
open for them to interpret their missions.
All Constructs have a built in dart thrower (treat as a
Light Crossbow), and many have other weapons built into
them as well. Minor Constructs will include weapons of
Hand or Short in length, while Major will have Long or
Longestst weapons built in.

Golem — Brass: Sz: Large, 5’-8’ tall; Clay: Sz: Large, 5’-8’
tall; Flesh: Sz: Large, 4’-7’ tall; Iron: Sz: Large, 5’-8’ tall;
Stone: Sz: Large, 5’-8’ tall; Encountered: 1
Golems are entities that are made from a single
substance, and then animated by being imbued with
a spirit. They appear and act as living statues, usually
humanoid in appearance. Their features only as
refined as their maker’s sculpting skills allowed.
Golems serve only their makers, responding to
simple commands. When attacking, if they cannot
close with their foe, they will throw rocks or other
items within reach. In melee, they will either bash their
foe with their fists, or try to grab them, following that
up with an attempt to crush the foe.
Should their maker be killed, the Golem will attempt
to either complete their last instruction, or become
uncontrolled, attacking everybody and everything.

246

Brass: Brass Golems are relatively quick, but tend to not
be very durable. They gain a +5 to initiative and their
Reflex Saves (already added in to their stats above).
Clay: Clay Golems appear to be made of soft clay, which
makes bashing attacks less damaging to them than
other attacks. However, this is countered by their
susceptibility to slashing attacks which can cut bits
and pieces of them off, whittling them down. Every 15
points of slashing damage done reduces their overall
level by one as well.
Flesh: Flesh Golems are often created by sewing portions
of multiple corpses together before animation. They
are capable of wearing clothing or armor and using
weapons and shields. It is possible that they may even
appear as a living being of the Kin from which they are
made. However, they always tend to be a little larger
than the Kins that they are made from. The most
famous Flesh Golem was created by a mad man by the
name of Frankenstein.
Iron: These are among the strongest types of Golems
and also one of the hardest to make. If a non-magical
wooden weapon is used to attack an Iron Golem and it
delivers hits, the wielder must make a Save against the
Golem’s level, at a -6, or the wooden weapon will break.
Stone: Stone golems are made from a single block of
stone, usually marble or granite. It is difficult to tell a
Stone Golem from other types of animated statues If a
non-magical wooden weapon is used to attack an Iron
Golem and it delivers hits, the wielder must make a
Save against the Golem’s level, at a -6, or the wooden
weapon will break.

Demons are creatures and beings from a group of related
planes known as the Abyss. These planes are also known
as the Nether Realms. The Nether Realms, Hades, and the
Shadow Realms are collectively known as the Infernal Realms
or the Lower Planes (p. 187).
Demons are extremely chaotic and evil in nature,
and revel in the torture and slaughter of those weaker
than themselves. They are only held in check through a
ruthless hierarchy that is ruled over by a Demon known as
Mephistopheles.
Mephistopheles has been known throughout all time by a
variety of names including Abbadon, Mephisto, Typhon, and
Beelzebub. It is said that his hatred is all consuming and that he
would bring down his own realm to destroy all of creation.
When a Demon is summoned or evoked, they must be
dealt with severely and quickly. Even the slightest hesitation
will be interpreted as weakness. This causes the Demon
to believe that it can twist and pervert the meaning of the
summoner’s commands.
Although Demons are vicious and cruel by their very
nature, they do fear the powers of good and of deities. They
will often initially recoil from the sight of holy symbols and
artifacts of a divine nature.
There is a great enmity between Demons and Devils. All
Demons must always attack Devils upon sight, or else they
face the wrath of Mephistopheles himself.
All Demons have the following attributes in common.
And since we are listing them here, we will not be listing
them again within the individual creature descriptions.
•• Soul Damage: Every attack from a Demon that
deals Critical Damage requires that the target make
a Toughness Save against the Demon’s level or it will
take 1 point of Soul Damage (p. 219).
•• Poison Immunity: Immune to venoms and poisons
•• Immune to non-magical weapons: Damage from
such weapons heals almost instantly)
•• Repulsed by Holy Symbol: Demons must make a
Will Save or avert its gaze and be unable to approach
wielder for 1-2 minutes.
•• Susceptibility: Hurt by Holy Water/Oil as described
in the Bless Water/Oil spell descriptions (p. 154).
•• Control Resistance: Immune to all influence and
control spells that are not specifically designed for
controlling or influencing demons.

Common Minor Demon — Sz: Miniscule, 12”-18”

247

tall, Encountered: 1 or 3-30
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard Demonic
abilities, Common Minor Demons also have the following:
•• Poison: One in ten Common Minor Demons will have
the ability to use a 3rd level poison that will give a -1 for
every point that+ the TSR is failed by.
•• Elemental Blast: One in ten Common Minor Demons
will have the ability to spit a small elemental bolt (choose
one) as an attack that has a DR of 10 hits.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one service or serve as a familiar.
Common Minor Demons can come in many form,
often taking the form of some sort of twisted animal,
often with extra limbs or protuberances like malformed
limbs with extra joints, or spikes. They never come in the
form of a creature that is able to fly, they are steadfastly
land based creatures.
One thing that they all have in common is glowing
red eyes. Another is their size, regardless of what they
look like, they are usually close to the same size.
Common Minor Demons are well suited to be
Familiars for those who traffic with demonic powers.

Demon Locusts — Sz: Large, 5’-6’ long, 9’ wingspan,
Encountered: 1 or 2-10

Special Abilities: In addition to the standard Demonic
abilities, Demon Locusts also have the following:
•• Immune to Control: Completely immune to any type
of spell that gives mental control over it.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will serve for up
to 10 minutes per level of the summoner; any relatively
simple command will be obeyed.
Demon Locusts seem almost mindless. They are
immune to any type of spells that control their minds.
They are able to be summoned and bound as any other
demon, so long mental control spells are not used.
Demon Locusts may not use their bite attack while
flying. Their bite, however, is acidic, dealing both
normal and acid damage (treat as Heat that causes
Bleeding equal to half the Hits dealt in the initial attack
each Round until the wound is flushed with water).
Demon Locusts may not use their claw attack when
on the ground. They have six legs, each of which are
razor sharp. While flying, they may hover over a target
and attack with all six claws! Each claw is a separate
attack roll and can be used to attack a separate target
(within melee range). These claws are Armor Piercing
(2), meaning that any AR against their claw attacks is
reduced by 2 points.

Grylins — Sz: Trivial, 4”-5” tall, 1-2 lbs, Encountered: 1 or 1-10

Special Abilities: In addition to the standard demonic
abilities, Grylins also have the following:
•• Invisibility: at will, not while making an attack
•• Sense Magic: by touch, no roll required
•• Sense Gates: 50’, with a successful Perception roll
•• Poison: 3rd level TSR or sleep for 5-10 minutes
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one service or serve as a familiar.
Grylins are covered in greenish scales, have small
bat-like wings, and their tails, back and head are often
covered in rows of tiny spikes. These spikes are often
black, yellow, blue or a deep blood-red in color.
A surprising number Grylin use their ability to spot
gates and portals to make their way to the material
plane to wreak whatever havoc they can.
Their tiny spears are covered in a poison that allows
them to put others to sleep so that they may have their
fun uninterrupted.

Larvae — Sz: Tiny, 1’-2’ long, 15-20 lbs, Encountered:

Fiends — Sz: Medium, 5’-6’ tall, 180-220 lbs, 12’ wingspan,

Encountered: 1-2
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard demonic
abilities, Fiends also have the following:
•• Immunity: Fiends are immune to heat and flame.
•• Fire Magic: Fiends have 3 Mana Points per level and may
freely cast any fire-based spells (2 MP per Fire Bolt).
•• Flaming Weapons: Their weapons are automatically
sheathed in flame, dealing an extra 6 points of damage
(already figured into their stats).
•• Sense Gates: 50’, with a successful Perception roll.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will serve for up
to 10 minutes per level of the summoner; any relatively
simple command will be obeyed.
Fiends are humaniod in form, with large bat-like wings,
and dark leathery skin. They are often found in the hotter
portions of the Abyss, such as lava pits or lakes of fire.
Fiends are often leaders of small groups of other Order I
demons, using them as minions and combatants.
In combat, they will use their claws or wield Arming
Swords or Whips that are also sheathed in flame.

2-20
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard demonic
abilities, Manes also have the following:
•• Disturbing Appearance: All who view must make
WSR versus the Larvae’s level or be nauseated (-4 to all
actions) for 1 minute per point of failure.
•• Disease Carrier: If bitten by Larvae, target must make
TSR versus Larvae’s level or die within 24 hours from
demonic disease if it is not treated.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one service or serve as a familiar.
Larvae are the most minor of the minor Demons.
They are created from the souls of evil humanoids
that have been consigned to the Nether Realms for
their sins. They exist in endless numbers on the lower
planes and are often tormented and preyed upon by
other Demons.
Larvae look like fat, slimy worms with human-like faces.
It is believed by some that the face of a Larvae resembles
the face it held when it was alive. Their skin is yellowish and
covered in mottled reddish brown splotches.
Larvae will attack anything that moves, except other
demons. They are slow moving, but they never tire and
will follow prey as long as it does not cross running
water, as the Larvae cannot swim.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Manes — Sz: Small, 3’ tall, 50-60 lbs, Encountered: 1-6

Special Abilities: In addition to the standard demonic
abilities, Manes also have the following:
•• Elemental Immunity: Immune to fire, cold and
electrical attacks.
•• Acute Smell: Often used as bloodhounds by other
demons, can even small magic within 50’.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one service or serve as a familiar.
Manes short bodies are covered with short, grayish
fur and they have pointy ears, deep-set glowing eyes
and heavy brows. They have claws on their hands and
feet and large fangs. Many Manes have a strip of darker
fur, slightly longer than the rest of their fur, which runs
from their forehead over their head and down their
back. The also often wear hooded cloaks when on the
Mortal Plane to to keep themselves hidden longer.
Manes are rumored to be immune to control spells,
but if that were they case, they could not be made
into Familiars. In any case, it is just lucky that spells of
banishment do work on them.
Manes make good familiars only for the most evil
of spell users as these creatures are not happy unless
they are engaged in some vile and twisted pursuit. They
will continuously work to pervert the most common
instructions given to them into something cruel and evil if
given just half a chance.

Orocabus — Sz: Medium, 6’-6.5’ tall, 200-250 lbs,

249

Encountered: 1-10
Special Abilities: Orocabus only have the standard
demonic abilities.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one service.

One of the most common type of Order I Demons
are called the Orocabus, but some refer to them as
Goatmen. This is because they appear to a mixture of
humanoid and goat, quite often complete with hooves
and horns, although this is not always the case. They
are sometimes confused with Satyrs, but the horns on
the Orocabus are always larger, curled ram’s horns.
They are universally considered to be ruthless, savage,
and completely untrustworthy. When summoned,
these creatures will often require the sacrifice of a small
animal to slake their bloodlust and to seal a pact. Once
a pact has been sealed, the Demon will obey any single
command, although complicated orders may be a bit
much for its mind to comprehend. Many times, its
savagery tends to overwhelm what intelligence it has.
In melee combat, these creatures prefer weapons
that slash or maul their foes, such as axes and spiked
clubs or maces, but they are not above using ranged
weapons and attacking foes from ambush as well.
They enjoy making a foe last as long as possible, and
will often go for disabling attacks at first rather than
killing attacks; all the better to prolong the suffering
of their targets.

There are a frozen group of lower planes known as The
Nine Hells, and sometimes called Hades. Hades, the Nether
Realms, and the Shadow Realms are collectively known as
the Infernal Realms or the Lower Planes (p. 187).
The evil inhabitants of Hades are known as Devils. Unlike the
chaos of Demons, Devils are very orderly, and faithfully adhere
to a chain of command known as the Order of Ascendancy.
Devils are ruled over by a sinister being of untold power
known as Asmodeus. It is rumored that Asmodeus and the
other arch-devils once resided in the upper planes, but that
they plotted to overthrow the gods and were subsequently
banished to the frozen planes of Hades.
It is said that Asmodeus now seeks a position of eminence
and respect among the mortal planes, to regain what was
lost with his banishment. It is also said that Asmodeus even
has a sense of humor, twisted as it may be, a quality that is
never attributed to the ruler of the Demon hordes.
When summoned, Devils need to be dealt with firmly, and
without hesitation. Anything else shows weakness and while
Devils are generally willing to aid those of a similar outlook,
they are loathe to render service to those that they deem
incompetent. Even worse than incompetence are those who
are in league with Demons, and Devils can literally smell the
“demon stink” on those who consort regularly with Demons.
All Devils despise Demons and will always attack them
on sight. It is said that the lower planes are in a constant
state of war between Demons and Devils.
Devils are, in a manner similar to Demons, repulsed by
holy symbols and artifacts of divine magic.
All Devils have the following attributes in common:
•• Soul Damage: Every attack from a Devil that deals
Critical Damage requires that the target make a
Toughness Save against the Devil’s level or it will take
1 point of Soul Damage (p. 219).
•• Immune to venoms and poisons
•• Immune to non-magical weapons (damage from
such weapons heals almost instantly)
•• Repulsed by Holy Symbol: Devil must make a Will
Save or avert its gaze and be unable to approach
wielder for 1 minute.
•• Susceptibility: Hurt by Holy Water/Oil as described
in the Bless Water/Oil spell descriptions (p. 154).
•• Immune to all influence and control spells that
are not specifically designed for controlling or
influencing devils.

Alastor (Evil Genius) — Sz: Miniscule, 6”-1’ tall, 2-5 lbs,

250

Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard devilish
abilities, Alastor also have the following:
•• Invisibilty: Once per day, up to 1 hour.
•• Shapechange: May shift to the form of a Hound, once
per day for up to an hour
•• Speak in Tongues: May speak any language, to Rank 5,
once a day for up to an hour
•• Sense Magic: May sense magic with Perception roll up
to 10’ away.
•• Regeneration: Heals 5 Hits per minute.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one minor service or serve as a familiar.
Alastor are tiny humanoids, covered in scales and
tiny spines, with small horns growing from their heads.
They are highly intelligent and on their home planes
will often serve as advisors to the less intelligent Garun
who guard the realms of the Nine Hells. They also often
act as intermediaries between various factions of Devils.
Their exceptional intelligence and their cunning has led
to Alastor often being referred to as “Evil Geniuses” and
they are often highly sought after as familiars.
They make superior familiars for those of an evil
disposition. Unless they are engaged in malicious activities
on a fairly regular basis, Alastor will cleverly twist the
meaning of any command or direction given to them to
suit its own twisted little purposes.
Alastor may be used for a number of useful purposes
such as delivering messages, spying, and performing minor
alchemical processes such as stirring a mixture or fetching
ingredients. When aiding in alchemical tasks, the Alastor
gives a +4 bonus to associated Alkemist skill rolls.
Once a month, an Alastor may be commanded to tell
his master the True Name (p. 140) of any one Lesser
(Order I) thru Greater Devil (Order III). The Alastor
performs this service gladly in an effort to increase his
master’s reliance upon the power of Hades.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Garun (Bat Horin) — Sz: Large, 4’-6’ tall, 150-250 lbs,

Encountered: 2-20
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard devilish
abilities, Garun also have the following:
•• Acute Senses: Gain +3 to Perception rolls.
•• Stealthy: Gain +2 to Stealth when outdoors.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one minor service or serve as a familiar.
Garun are bat-like humanoid creatures with large,
flat noses and sharp claws. They have no wings, and
their arms end in wicked claws. Garun are excellent
trackers and hunters, able to trace prey over long
distances and extremely adverse conditions.
When summoned, Garun will only perform services
that involve the hunting of prey, or fighting a Demon,
which it will do gladly. Any other commands will be
met with the Garun attempting its best to twist the
command in some fashion.
Garun make up the bulk of devilish armies much like
Goatmen make up the bulk of demonic armies. However,
the Garun are much more disciplined and willing to fight
for more powerful Devils, and don’t require the same
amount of oversight that Goatmen require.

Grimalkin (Shadow Cat) — Sz: Tiny, 2’-3’ long, 10-15 lbs,

251

Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard devilish
abilities, Grimalkin also have the following:
•• Shapechange: May shaprechange into an old hag, once
per day for up to an hour.
•• Speak in Tongues: May speak any language, to Rank
5, once a day for up to an hour
•• Animal Tongue: The ability to speak to any animal.
•• Sense Magic: May scent magic with Perception roll up
to 10’ away.
•• Regeneration: Heals 5 Hits per minute.
•• Shadow Friend: Gains a +15 to Stealth in total
darkness (+7 in Dim Light).
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one minor service or serve as a familiar.
Their normal form is that of a large black cat. This
creature’s form is so dark, that it gets a huge bonus
to Stealth attempts in darkness. This makes them
excellent spies.
Grimalkin are highly prized as familiars because,
unlike Alastor, a Grimalkin will never cause problems
for their masters. They are of the belief that their own
presence is enough of a predilection towards evil,
regardless of what they profess.
Like the Alastor, the Grimalkin may, no more than
once per month, reveal the True Name (p. 140) of any
one Lesser (Order I) thru Greater Devil (Order III).

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Hellion — Sz: Miniscule, 6”-8” tall, 2-3 lbs, Encountered: Stone Devil — Sz: Large, 4’-5’ tall, 175-250 lbs,
2-20
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard devilish
abilities, Hellions also have the following:
•• Armor Piercing: All attacks ignore the first 3 points of
Armor Rating.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one minor service or serve as a familiar.
Hellions are tiny little humanoids, with a deep red
leathery skin and small horns. They also have barbed
tails that are as long as they are tall. They attack by
either biting or using their tiny pitchforks, both of
which possess their Armor Piercing (3) capability.
Contrary to their size, Hellions are able to move
quickly in seemingly disproportionate leaps and
bounds. This allows them to move almost as fast as
larger creatures.
They are viscous in combat as they attack in packs.
Wounds from these creatures are brutal—meaning
that magic cannot heal the wounds and the normal
healing rate is reduced to one-tenth normal. While
healing, if not kept clean, the chances of infection are
double normal.

Imp — Sz: Small, 2’-3’ tall, 10-20 lbs, Encountered: 1-4

Special Abilities: In addition to the standard devilish
abilities, Imps also have the following:
•• Shapechange: May shapechange into the form of a
small animal, not greater than 3’ in height or length,
once per day for up to an hour.
•• Invisible: May turn invisible at will, but not in combat.
•• Sense Magic: May sense magic with Perception roll
up to 10’ away.
•• Regeneration: Heals 5 Hits per minute.
•• Tail Venom: TSR versus 5th level or take 1d5 Hits
(plus 1 Hit per point of failure) per round for 3 rounds.
Those poisoned are also at -4 during this period from
the pain.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one minor service or serve as a familiar.
Imps have tough leathery skin and small, but
functional bat-like wings. They have slightly bulbous
heads with long pointy ears and sinister facial features.
Their bodies are often covered with tiny barbs and
spikes, and their hands and feet end in wicked, razor
sharp claws. And to top it all off, they have a 5’ long,
thin, prehensile tail that ends in a barbed stinger that
has a potent venom.
Imps are prized as superior familiars because they
are among the most versatile of the Lesser Devils.
Some Imps even know how to use weapons that
have been scaled down to their size (does 2 points of
damage less than normal sized weapons).
The Imp can also, no more than once per month,
reveal the True Name (p. 140) of any one Lesser (Order
I) thru Greater Devil (Order III).
252

Encountered: 1-10
Special Abilities: In addition to the standard devilish
abilities, Stone Devils also have the following:
•• Immune: Totally immune to any spells or effects that
would change their form or body (i.e. Petrifying).
•• Regeneration: Heals 5 Hits per minute.
Services Rendered: when summoned, will perform any
one minor service or serve as a familiar.
These creatures look like, and are often mistaken as,
gargoyles. They are sometimes called False Gargoyles
because of this.
This causes actual gargoyles no end of trouble.
Stone Devils, as their name implies, have hides as
tough as stone, providing the equivalent protection of
plate armor.
The barbs on their skin are sharp and jagged
dealing extra damage (already added in) in any form
of grappling combat. This includes their Charging
Ram attack; which requires 10 feet of running or 20
feet of flying prior to being initiated.
This ram attack is one of their favorites as their
tough, stone-like skin protects them from taking such
damage on their own.

The beasts in this section share a number of similar
characteristics, the most fundemental of which are their
reptilian features. Many of these creatures also possess various
abilities that may be considered enchanted in nature.

Basilisk — Sz: Huge, 10’-15’ long, 1,000-3,000 lbs, 1-4

young (eggs or hatchlings) Encountered: 1 or 2-5
Special Abilities: Basilisks have the following ability:
•• Petrifying Gaze: Basilisks will attempt to meet the
gaze of any that meet. It requires a Reflex Save Roll to
avoid the creature’s gaze.
The Basilisk is a large reptilian creature that may
be related to the much smaller Cockatrice, as both are
what are known as petrifactors, meaning that they have
the capability to turn other creatures to stone.
A Reflex Save Roll will allow a target to avoid meeting
the gaze of the Basilisk. Failure on this Save determines
how long one is petrified. The duration of petrification
can often be lessened through the use of herbs, spells, or
even rituals.
The Basilisk deliberately tries to turn creatures to
stone. Those that it transforms will petrify from the
outside in, and the target is in a kind of stasis until the
petrification wears off. However, this does not bother
the Basilisk as they eat both the petrified flesh and and
the soft tissues both. As one scholar once quipped,
“Basilisks like their dinner crunchy on the outside and
squishy on the inside.”
Basilisks can be found in almost any terrain, though
they tend to prefer more temperate climates. And quite
luckily, they tend to be solitary creatures, except during
their mating season, and their young do not possess the
petrification ability until they reach maturity.
Failed By

~Cave Drakes~
Cave Drakes resemble their more dangerous cousin, the
Dragon, in all but two respects.
Unlike Dragons, Cave Drakes do not have wings, nor do
they have breath weapons, and more importantly, they are
not sentient like Dragons. This means that Cave Drakes also
are not capable of casting spells like Dragons do. This makes
them look like very large lizards covered in large scales and
spikes an horns jutting from their backs.
Most Cave Drakes have many of the same habits as true
Dragons, liking to live alone, except during their mating seasons.
Cave Drakes also do not posess the breath weapon that Dragons
have, and they also prefer lairing in caves, as their name implies.
Cave Drakes are similar to a species of bird known as a
magpie, in that it likes shiny objects and like to keep them
in its nest. This is likely the origin of the myth that Dragons
hoard gold and other treasures. They just like the shiny.

Cave Drake, Wyrmling/Young — Sz: Large/Huge,

5’-15’ long, not including a 3’-10’ long tail, 500-2,500 lbs,
10-30/31-150 years old, Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: Cave Drakes have the following ability:
•• Acidic Bite: Damage dealt by the bite automatically
deals 1 point of Bleeding for every 5 points of damage dealt
due to the acid in its saliva. This bleeding continues until
the bite wound is flushed with water to remove the acid.
Cave Drakes leave their mother’s nest once they
reach 5’ in length (not counting their 3’ long tail).
This is when they transition from the Hatchling to
the Wyrmling age category. Cave Drakes at this age
will start fighting each other, so must search out their
own territories, where they will reside alone until they
reach adulthood and heed the urge to look for a mate.
During this time, a Cave Drake will grow an
addition foot of length for every 10 years until they
reach adulthood.
Once they reach 150 years of age, they will finally
become an adult Cave Drake.

Cave Drake, Adult — Sz: Colossal, 15’-40’ long, not

including 10’-15’ long tail, 2,500-3,500 lbs, 151- 500
years old, 2-6 eggs, Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: Cave Drakes have the following ability:
•• Acidic Bite: Damage dealt by the bite automatically deals
1 point of Bleeding for every 3 points of damage dealt due
to the acid in its saliva. This bleeding continues until the
bite wound is flushed with water to remove the acid.
Adult Cave Drakes will grow another foot of length
for every 15 years that pass. They will also seek out an
mate once every 20 years once they reach adulthood.
Cave Drakes are very territorial, and as they get
older, they also get less likely to tolerate intruders into
the area that they consider to be theirs.

Dragonette — Sz: Tiny, 12”-24” long, 5-10 lbs, 10-30

eggs, Encountered: 1 or (wild) 2-20
Special Abilities: Dragonettes have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Fire Bolt: Dragonettes may spit a small bolt of fire up
to 12 times a day.
•• Teleport: Dragonettes have the ability to teleport to
any place that they know.
•• Empathic: Dragonettes are able to sense the emotions
of those with 20’. If they have imprinted, they may
convey their own emotions to their friend.
•• Imprinting: If present at the birth of a Dragonette, a
person may feed the hatchling into a stupor and in doing so,
imprint upon the hatchling. From that point on, it will stay
with and protect their new friend.
Dragonettes look like miniature Dragons, rarely
reaching a three feet in length from their nose to the
tip of their tail. They even come in many of the same
colors as full sized Dragons, but regardless of color,
their small breath weapon is always of fire.

254

While Dragonettes can be found in almost any climate,
they return to warm locales for mating, laying their eggs
in the sand and burying them to keep them warm.
Upon first hatching, Dragonettes are ravenously
hungry, and they can bond with someobody who is
on hand and able to feed them. This bond creates an
empathic link between the Dragonette and the person,
and once formed, the bond lasts for the life of both
parties. A bonded Dragonette will stay with and follow
its friend, protecting them if need be.
Another unique ability of Dragonettes is that they are
able to teleport. There is no known limit to how far that
the Dragonette is able to teleport. Scholars have noticed,
however, that Dragonettes never seem to teleport from a
stationary location. That they always seem to be be in the
air when they wink out or back in. There also seems to be
no limit to how often they can teleport, though doing it
too often in a short period does seem to tire them out and
make them hungry.
There have also been reports of Dragonettes sharing
images across the bond, which makes some scholars
think that there might be some telepathic elements to
the empathic link that is formed at hatching. Because
some of the images appear to be things from the distant
past, Scholars also believe that the Dragonettes may also
possess some sort of racial memory of things that have
happened to or been witnessed by other Dragonettes.
They also believe that all Dragonettes have access to this
collective memory.
When fighting, Dragonettes tend to use diving
tactics, using their claws to rake their foes as this allows
them to retain the mobility and allows them the best
chance to use their teleporting abilities in conjunction
with their attacks, allowing for them to attack from
unexpected directions.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

~Dragons (Great Wyrms)~
Dragons are creatures of legend. They are vastly powerful
creatures, both physically and magically. It is said by some
scholars that Dragons were among the first creatures to arise,
that they soared across the skies when humans were still
living in trees.
Whether this is true or not, we may never know, but both
history and legends are filled with Dragons as far back as
anybody can remember.
Dragons are great reptiles, often reaching lengths of 50’
or more at their oldest. They are covered in thick, scaly hide
and many dragons also sport horns, spikes, and even a row
or two of ridges that run from the base of their head to the
tips of their tails. They all have four limbs and a set of wings
that can fold flat against their back.
Dragons are usually generally uniform in color along their
sides and backs, with lighter coloration on their underside.
A Dragon’s color often has a correlation to the type of
breath weapon that it wields and the School of Magic that it
casts from, once it is old enough to do so. Here is a list of the
different types of Dragons and their color-based abilities:
Gold Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Fire (cone or line, Dragon’s choice)
•• Primary School of Magic: Wizardry
Silver Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Lightning (line)
•• Primary School of Magic: Mysticism
Bronze Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Fire (cone or line, Dragon’s choice)
•• Primary School of Magic: Sorcery
Black Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Acid (line), does half the listed
damage each round for 1-10 rounds unless washed
off using water
•• Primary School of Magic: Diabolism
Blue Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Lightning (line)
•• Primary School of Magic: Wizardry
Green Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Acid (line), does half the listed
damage each round for 1-10 rounds unless washed
off using water
•• Primary School of Magic: Druidism
Red Dragon
•• Breath Weapon: Fire (cone)
•• Primary School of Magic: Magery
White Dragons
•• Breath Weapon: Frost (cone), use half listed damage,
victims must make a Toughness Save Roll or take 1 hit
(for every 5 hits of initial damage dealt) each round
due to Frostbite. Success Levels from the attack also
increase the level of the Save.
•• Primary School of Magic: Wizardry

Unlike other creatures, we present you with not one, but
5 different stat blocks for Dragons. We have provided one
stat block for each “age” or stage of development that that a
Dragon has. We also list the different abilities that Dragons
gain as they age.
Only Adult Dragons mate and produce children. A female
dragon can lay up to 6 eggs at a time, but never more than
once or twice a century during her fertile period. The mother
dragon will care for her young for the first few years, but
once old enough; Wyrmlings are thrust out upon the world
to make their own way and to find their own territories. The
mother Dragon often visits during this period, continuing
the education of her offspring.
Once they are old enough, Dragons are also able to change
their shape to that of any type of lesser creature, though they
cannot duplicate a specific creature or person. Many Dragons
never use this ability as changing shape often prevents them
from using many of their other natural abilities.
In fact, Gold Dragons seem to be the most curious about
other creatures and beings. They are often the ones most likely
to change shape and wander about visiting the other Kins.
However, every Young Dragon is taught to take humanoid
forms, and they do tend to spend at least a few years living
among the lesser Kins to learn their ways.

Dragon, Wyrmling — Sz: Large, 6’-14’ long,

up to 3 times a day.
•• Immunity: Immune to sleep or paralysis effects.
•• Sense Magic: May detect magic by scent, up to 10’.
•• Night Sight: Have Night Sight, as described on p. 205.

Dragon, Adult — Sz: Colossal, 26’-35’ long, 4,000-

The Metallic Dracorex is currently the most ancient
of the Gold Dragons, while the Chromatic Dracorex is
currently a Black Dragon of immense age.
The Metallic Dragons tend to like order and are
more favorable to the lesser, mortal Kins, although
you could not call them altruistic or even good in the
normal sense. The Chromatic Dragons, on the other
hand prefers chaos and destruction.
These two factions of Dragons hate each other and
have been at war for ages. However, they rarely fight
directly, due to how few Dragons there are. Instead,
they often using proxies, such as servants and minions
of various types.
This make both Dragon Kings very similar to what
are referred to as Darkmasters (p. 228), since they are
at war with one another and neither is above using the
mortals of the world to fight this war in tiny skirmishes.
The Dracorex also control the populations of their
factions, as they both know that too many Dragons will
only cause the mortal realms to unite agains them all.
Thus, both sides tend to avoid the lesser Kins, unless
looking for the occassional proxy or servant.
The Dracorex play a long game against each other,
vying to be the one true Dragon King. They make war
upon one another using proxies, such as servants and
minions, often to fight

20’-30’ wingspan, Encountered: 1-4
Special Abilities: Fellwings have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: Have Night Sight, as described on p. 205.
•• Terrifying Presence: All within 100’ must make aWill

It is thought that perhaps Fellwings are left over
from a previous age, before the rise of the Dragons,
and that in that time, they once ruled the world.
They were once thought to be long extinct, until
they were resurrected or recreated by a Darkmaster,
allowing them to serve as mounts for his most trusted
servants, but also releasing them into the wild, for the
sheer pleasure of watching the terror that they create.
The tactics of these creatures resembles that of birds
of prey, often swooping down to grab or rake a foe,
using their speed to their advantage.

Hydra — Sz: Colossal, 5’-10’ long necks, 5’-15’ long body, 5’-

10’ long tail, 3-9 heads, 2,000-3,000 lbs, Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: Hydra have the following abilities:
•• Regenerative Heads: All but the primary head will
regenerate if cut off, unless the neck stump is cauterized.
•• Primary Head: The primary head is immune to being
Stunned, but it can be killed.
•• Breath Weapon: Each head is able to breath fire in a
Cone (40’ long, 20’ wide at the far end) up to 10x a day,
but not more than once a minute.
The Hydra has a heavy scaled body and tail, but
without the spikes and horns that a Dragon or Cave
Drake might have. They have four limbs ending in
large clawed feet.
What really sets them apart from other draconic
creatures is that they have multiple heads.
One of the heads (GM should give each head a
number and choose one at random) is the primary
head. If that head is killed, the Hydra dies.
If any of the other heads are killed, the neck will
split into two and two new heads will grow (in 2-20
rounds), until there is a maximum of 9 heads in total.

Sirrush — Sz: Gigantic, 20’-40’ long, including 5’-10’ tail,

1,000-2,000 lbs, Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: ISirrus have the following abilities:
•• Prehensile Tongue: Sirrush have a tongue that can
reach from 5’-10’ and is able to grab prey, dragging it
close enough to be mauled to death.
•• Innate Illusions: The Sirrush, while not truly
intelligent, has the abilty to cast an illusion over itself, to
help it blend into its surroundings. This illusion always
has the fringe effect. This should be treated as a bonus
to its Stealth skill equal to half its level.
The Sirrush is sometimes called a Mushussu or more
commonly called a Marsh Drake, due to its propensity
to live in marshes and swamps.
This scaly creature has a relatively smaller body
with a long neck, legs and tail. It front legs resemble
a reptilian version of those found on a lion, while its
back legs look more like the cruel talons found on
large birds of prey. Scholars believe that this unusual
arrangement allows the Sirrush to move more easily
through its swampy home.
Unlike Dragons, the Sirrush does not have wings
or a breath weapon. What is does have is a very long,
prehensile tongue that it uses to snatch unwary prey.
The Sirrush is also what would be called an ambush
predator, laying in wait, until prey passes close enough
for it to grab its next meal.

257

1,500-3,000 lbs, 1-6 eggs/young, Encountered: 1-2
Special Abilities: Wyverns have the following abilities:
•• Prehensile Tail: The Wyvern’s tail is prehensile, meaning
that it can grab and hold things with its tail, even though it
does not use this ability often.
•• Poison Stinger: The Wyvern’s tail is tipped with a
stinger much like the one found on scorpions. It delivers
an 8th level poison upon a successful strike that delivers
at least 1 Success Level.
Wyverns are thought to be kin to Dragons. However,
they are easily distinguished from Dragons by the fact
that they do not possess front limbs, only rear limbs and
their wings, much like birds. Additionally, their long
tails are tipped with a large and nasty looking stinger.
Dragons look down on Wyverns because they have
no breath weapon and are not intelligent enough to
cast spells. While Wyverns are smarter than animals,
they are far from being as intelligent as Dragons. They
are also extremely aggressive, preferring to attack first.
They are only willing to parley against a foe that is
obviously stronger than they are and that they cannot
flee from.
Young Wyverns may hunt in small groups, but as the
Wyverns get older, they tend towards being more solitary.
A full-grown Wyvern usually has a territory of 75 to 150
square miles that it considers as its own. Wyverns will
fight other Wyverns to the death for a territory that is
filled with easy prey.
It has been rumored that other creatures have
befriended or subdued Wyverns and perhaps even
used them as mounts, but this unsubstantiated.

Failed By

Wyvern Poison Results

01-05

Mild Effect: Begins in 3-30 rounds, lasts 1-10 hours. Effects include
lightheadedness, swelling and pain (-2), and bleeding (1-5 Hits for a
number of rounds equal to amount Save failed by.

06-10

Moderate Effect: Begins in 5-50 rounds. Target loses coordination
(-6) and has a 6% chance (roll of 2-4 on 2d10) each round that they
cannot perform actions due to muscles not working properly.

11-15

Severe Effect: Begins in 1-10 hours with feaver and sweating with the
target lapsing into unconsciousness for 1-10 days.

16+

Dire Effect: Target dies in 5-50 hours due to overall muscle failure,
especially that most vital muscle, the heart.
