DR-# = The Fey use their equivalent of weapons, but the Damage Ratings are scaled back due to their size - for example a Gremlin melee weapon is DR-1, so a short sword
for Gremlins would have a DR of 9s/6p instead of its normal 10s/7p.

The Fey originally hail from a realm known only as the
Otherlands. The Otherlands are accessed through special
locations such Fairy Rings or small, hollow hills known as
Fairy Mounds. They are divided into two groups, the Seelie
Court, who is dangerous and capricious, but more generally
beneficially disposed to the other Kins, even as they often play
mostly harmless pranks. And then there is the Unseelie Court
which is often malicious and spiteful, and who often view
harming others as a form of entertainment.
Many lesser Fey, especially from the Unseelie Court, will often
end up working for somebody who is more powerful than they
are, so long as they also get to exercise their true nature.
The Fey Folk are a small people, rarely topping 4’ in
height for the largest of the Fey Folk. Many types of Fey are
much smaller than that. And almost all of them have some
magical abilities in common.
Here is a list of abilities that all Fey have:
•• Cantrips: Many Fey know a number of Cantrips equal
to double their level, up to 20 Cantrips in total.
•• Dark Sight: All Fey have the ability to see both at night
and in total darkness. They have Dark Sight as described
on p. 206.
•• Natural Camouflage: All Fey gain the ability to naturally
camouflage their selves. This grants them a +4 to their
Stealth rolls.
•• Second Sight: All Fey have the Second Sight as per the Special
Skill (p. 58).
•• Sense Magic: All Fey may sense the presence of magic
within a 20’ radius with a Perception roll. They gain a +2
to this roll if they are attempting to sense magic.
•• Susceptibility: All Fey take x1.5 damage (round up)
from steel weapons, and x2 damage from iron weapons.
•• Fey Metals: Many Fey who use metal weapons will use
weapons made from metal alloys that do not include iron
or steel, although they are just as strong. These Fey metals
often have a metalic green sheen to identify them.

Bakru — Sz: Miniscule, 6”-12” tall, 1-2 lbs, 1-3 offspring,

258

Encountered: (raiding party) 2-20 or (village) 20-300

Special Abilities: Bakru have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
Bakru are a malign type of Fey who inhabit warm
temperate and tropical forests. They are quite repulsive
to behold, having shriveled features and deep-set, dark
eyes. Many have long hair and the males are always
bearded. Hair and skin coloration are usually identical,
with the most common pigmentation being dirty
brown or dark green.
They are migratory hunters and gatherers, having
no permanent dwellings. They often domesticate small
creatures such as Giant Rats, or small to medium sized
dogs, small deer or similar animals to use as steeds or
beasts of burden.
They are experts at making intricate snares, setting
large snares to ward of larger foes, they use smaller
ones to trap poisonous snakes, to be able to milk them
for their venom. They use this venom, mixed with
several other ingredients to treat their tiny spears,
allowing any strike by them to impart their poisonous
effects (any foe hit by a Bakru spear that earns a Success
Level must make a TSR against a 5th level poison or
take 2d10 Hits and be at -4 from the pain for 1 round
for each point that the Save is failed by).
Bakru will often sneak into the encampments or
villages of the larger Kins to steal food, supplies and
treasure (they prefer gems over coins). They will also
sabotage things or lay traps to catch the unwary. This
includes sawing most of the way threw wagon wheels,
backpack straps or bow strings, so that they break or
snap the first time that they are used. They are also
known to mix their poisons into wine and water skins.
Some of the bolder Bakru have even been known to
sneak into an adventurer’s camp and tie somebody up.
Many small villages will often leave out offerings to
Bakru to avoid such depredations. However, this also
often entices the Bakru to remain in the area rather
than continuing with their nomadic lifestyle.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Boggart/Brownie — Sz: Tiny, 24”-30” tall, 30-40 lbs, Fossegrim — Sz: Medium, 4’-5’ tall, 130-160 lbs,
Encountered: 1

Encountered: 1

Special Abilities: Brownies and Boggarts all have the
following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
These are small beings, that resemble very short
Gnomes, but without the beards, and some scholars
believe that the two Kins may be related in the far distant
past. Brownies are considered to be part of the Seelie
Court since they are usually well disposed towards the
larger Kins. If approached in a friendly manner, Brownies
are able to repair objects of wood, metal or leather with
ease. Boggarts, on the other hand, are Brownies that have
turned to evil, perhaps due to mistreatment by one of the
larger Kins, and they belong to the Unseelie Court.
Both prefer pastoral locales, such fields along the
edges of forests especially. They make their homes
underground, with the entrances always being cleverly
concealed and etremely hard to find.
The only weapon that these beings usually carry is
what they consider to be a short sword (a dagger to any
of the larger Kins).

Fear Dearg — Sz: Small, 36”-54” tall, 55-80 lbs,
Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Fear Dearg have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
•• Red Cap: All attacks do +4 Hits of damage while
they wear their red cap. While wearing the cap, they
also regenerate 1 hit per minute. If lost, they lose these
abilities until they can make a new cap (takes 10
minutes) and dip it in the blood of one they helped kill.
The Fear Dearg are also called Fir Darrig, or Redmen
because of their habitual wearing of a ratty red coat
that goes along with their red cap. They are even more
malicious than Redcaps.
Fear Dearg often work with groups of Redcaps,
serving as their leaders. Many scholars believe that the
Fear Dearg are akin to royalty in Redcap society, ruling
over them, while others believe that the association is
similar to Goblins and Hobgoblins.
All Fear Dearg are practitioners of magic and
hoarders of all sorts of magical trinkets and mystical
scrolls, of which they’re very jealous. In fact, the
practice of magic or possession of any enchanted item
by any non-Fear Dearg is a crime punishable by death
in Redcap society.
Faer Dearg practice Diabolism (excluding Summoning)
or Wizardry, having 5 Mana Points per level, and knowing
at least 2 Spells for every level that they have. Use their Knw
bonus as their skill bonus for casting spells.

Special Abilities: Fossegrim have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
•• Susceptibility: Must immerse themselves in water at
least 90 miutes per day; at -4 for each day missed, in a
coma at -16, death at -20.
•• Amphibian: Can breath both water and air.
Fair skinned, and having black and green hair, the
Fossegrim watch over the other water-related Fey.
They tend to live in pools under waterfalls, and are
often considered to be both wise and kind. Their habit
of rescuing of drowning mortals often bring them into
contact with the mannish Kins.
Gremlin — Sz: Small, 2’-3’ tall, 30-40 lbs, Encountered: 2-20
Special Abilities: Gremlins have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities,
except Cantrips, listed at the start of this section.
•• Susceptibility: Gremlins are considered Stunned in
direct sunlight.
The spite that fills these small creatures is echoed in
their withered skin and deformed limbs. These wicked
Fey file their teeth into triangular fangs and they wear
metal gaurds on their fingers that resemble claws.
The mannish Kins usually take the brunt of their
hatred, but no on remains exempt from their ugly
humor. Gremlins will often turn their frustrations on
each other if there are no other targets.
Pixie — Sz: Miniscule, 12”-18” tall, 2’ wingspan, 4-5 lbs,
Special Abilities: Pixies have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
•• Invisibility: May turn invisible a number of times per
day equal to their level.
•• Illusion: May cast a single illusion with both visual and
auditory components, once per day, lasts 10 minutes.
•• Pixie Dust: May shake dust from their wings once per
day for each level that they have. May be used as an 8th
level sleep poison, or grant 12 hours of flight to a willing
target (no more than once per month per person).
Pixies look like tiny elves. Their wings appear much
like those of a dragonfly, or a butterfly. Which type of
wing that they have depends upon the individual Pixie.
Pixies have a strong love of fun and pranks. There
is no true malice in those pranks, and a benevolent
interest in certain mortals may lead a Pixie to provide
some helpful guidance or even to abandon their own
people for a few years to accompany and aid a mortal
companion, especially if that companion is interesting
or is doing interesting things.
When it comes to physical attacks, Pixies wield tiny
swords that are treated as Daggers. For their ranged
attacks, they use bows and arrows sized for them.

259

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Redcap — Sz: Small, 3’-4’ tall, 45-75 lbs, Encountered: 2-20

Spriggan — Sz: Small, 30”-36” tall, 40-60 lbs

Special Abilities: Spriggan have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
•• Invisibility: May turn invisible a number of times per
day equal to their level.
•• Illusion: May cast a single illusion with both visual
and auditory components, once per day, that lasts for
10 minutes. Treat as the Illusions (p. 164) spell cast at
the Spriggan’s level.
Spriggans are grotesquely ugly, wizened looking old
men with large childlike heads. They usually appear in
ragged clothing, and carrying a long knife or dagger
made of Fey Metals as if it were a sword. Others walk
with a staff as tall as they are (treat as a cudgel or
hanbo) and use it to attack if needed.
It is said that they can be found in old ruins, cairns,
and barrows guarding buried treasure. Whatever, the
truth, these fey creatures are dangerous at best, due
to their foul tempers and willingness to go after foes
larger than themselves.
The Spriggan have 3 times their level in Magic Points
to spend on casting spells (Druidism/Magery) related to
storms and lightning.

Special Abilities: Redcaps have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Only has Dark Sight, Natural Camouflage,
Susceptibility and Fey Weapons.
•• Red Cap: All attacks do +4 Hits of damage while
they wear their red cap. While wearing the cap, they
also regenerate 1 hit per minute. If lost, they lose these
abilities until they can make a new cap (takes 10
minutes) and dip it in the blood of one they helped kill.
Redcaps are diminutive humanoids with ashen skin,
yellow eyes and pointed teeth. They are some of the most
viscious of the Fey Kins, often serving as soldiers of the
Unseelie Court. They take their name from their habit of
dipping their caps in the blood of their enemies.
They are relatively strong for creatures of their stature,
and naturally resistant to both extreme temperatures
and poisonous substances. Redcaps are petty, murderous
creatures who love to fight and hate all that is beautiful.
Radcaps rarely like fair fights, preferring to
outnumber their foes by 2 to 1 if at all possible.

Satyr — Sz: Medium, 5’-6’ tall, 150-200 lbs, 1-2 young,
Encountered: 1-10

Special Abilities: Satyr have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
Standing as tall as most Humans, Satyrs have upper
bodies and heads that look like humans, except for the
horse-like ears growing from their head. Their lower
bodies resemble the legs of a horse, including hooves
rather than feet.
Satyrs are usually a happy and merry being, loving
to play and frolic through the woods in which they live.
Satyrs carry and play a musical instrument called
Pan Pipes. They are able to cast spells from the Bard
Folio (subset of Wizardry School of Magic), up to their
level using the music from their pipes. A Satyr has 5
Magic Points per level to use in casting these spells.
Satyrs move twice as fast as a human when
running, although their normal walking speeds tend
to be comparable. Satyrs also appear to live their entire
lives with joyful abandon, filling their lives with wild
stamping dances, and their own festivals and feasts.
It is rare, but not unheard of for a Satyr to leave
his forest home, and join bands of adventurers for a
few years to explore and see the world before returning
home and settling down.
In combat, Satyrs prefer weapons like staves and
spears and occassionally smaller blades, often made
from Fey Metals, like Short Swords or Smallswords.
For ranged combat, they prefer short bows over other
types of ranged weapons.
Scholars also report that even in combat, nobody has
ever reported Satyrs wearing any type of metal based
armor, almost as if they had an allergy or aversion to it,
but neither has ever been proved to be true.

Tylweth Teg — Sz: Small, 36”-42” tall, 50-60 lbs, Encounter:

260

1 or 2-10

Special Abilities: Tylweth Teg have the following abilities:
•• Fey Abilities: Has all of the common Fey abilities listed
at the start of this section.
•• Invisibility: May turn invisible a number of times per
day equal to their level.
•• Illusion: May cast a single illusion with both visual
and auditory components, once per day, that lasts for
10 minutes. Treat as the Illusions (p. 164) spell cast at
the Tylweth Teg’s level.
These small beings resemble golden haired elves.
They are often confused with and/or mistaken for
Dwelfs, even though Dwelfs never had golden colored
hair and the Tylweth Teg are always without beards or
mustaches. They are the most numerous of the Seelie
Court, and often work to counter the depredations of
the Unseelie Court.
When not hunting the Unseelie, the Tylweth Teg
can often be found astride their Fey steeds on other
hunts. Many mortals have been lured by them into the
Otherlands where a single night could reflect decades
or even centuries in the mortal world. Only a dire
threat or personal feud will cause a Teg to leave the
Otherlands for the world of mortals.

* = DM applies to the vines only, the Bud/Central pod of the plant has a DM of zero.

Assassin Vine — Sz: Large, 10-20 vines (15 Hits per
vine) that are 15’-20’ in length, Encountered: 1-10

Special Abilities: Assassin Vines have the following abilities:
•• Animate Vines: Has from 2-10 vines, each 15’-20’ long,
that can grapple and then strangle (TSR each round, failure
means lose 1 point of Stamina, 0 Stamina means death).
The Assassin Vine is actually a singular plant
with multiple vines reaching out across the forest or
swamp floor in all directions. They can sense nearby
movement and attack any living creature that wander
within 10’-15’ of their central bulb. The vines then
grab such targets, grappling the target, while other
vines move to strangle its victim.
Once the victim is dead, the vines place its corpse
near the central bulb to allow it to decompose and
fertilize the ground.
The Assassin Vine can use its vines to drag itself to
a new hunting ground, but this is slow process as it
can only move about 100’ in an entire day. This has
sometimes cause the Assassin Vine to encroach upon
poorly tended fields or vineyards. Their seeds, which
as considered delicacies by avian creatures, could be
spread far and wide if a bird is swift enough to pluck a
few free and escape before the vine can catch it.

Howlers — Sz: Tiny - Medium, 1’-5’ tall, Encountered: 5-10
Special Abilities: Howlers have the following abilities:
•• Piercing Howl: Light/heat sources or movement within
10’ of a Howler causes it to emit a piercing sound that
lasts for 1 round per foot of height that it has. All creatures
within 30 feet of a Howler when it emits this noise must
make a TSR (vs Level 5) or take 1d10 hits of damage, and
be deafened for one round for each hit taken.
This mindless plant resembles a giant mushroom.
They grow in dark areas with no light, and so
movemment or light getting too close causes them
to release the air trapped within their stems through
special chambers in their heads.
This usually attracts any creatures in the area, and
so it is not unusual to find the remains of previous
intruders moldering around the base of the Howlers,
providing them with nutrients.
A number of creatures and Kins who live underground
will cultivate these plants as intruder alarms guarding
various approaches or entrances to their lairs.

Trapping Plant — Sz: Medium, 2’-3’ wide/tall, 1-10 vines

Exploding Mushrooms — Sz: Miniscule, 6”-12”
tall, Encountered: 10-20 in a 50’ radius

Special Abilities: This plant has the following ability:
•• Poison Spores: Explosion creates 5’ radius cloud of
spores. Spores act as 15th level poison that deals 5d10
Hits of damage.
As these mushrooms ripen, the spores found inside
their umbrellas produce ever increasing pressure.
In late autumn, they will naturally burst through an
opening in their tops, sending a plume of spores 20’
high into the air for the wind to carry away.
However, should the unwary step upon them before
they plume, they will explode, creating a 5’ radius
cloud, bathing the one who disturbed them in its
poisonous spores.

261

10’-20’ long (15 hits per vine), Encountered: 2-20

Special Abilities: Trapping Plants have the following Abilities:
•• Vine Tentacles: Each vine may make independent
attacks each round.
•• Acid Digestion: Once pulled into the bud, a victim takes
5 Hits of Acid damage per round until it is consumed.
The Trapping Plant, often called a Trapper, looks
much like a giant flower bud comprised of large,
tough leaves. From its base, what appear to be creeping
“vines” extend outwards. Often, these vines will extend
under or around other plants, so that they will be
encountered before the bud of the plant can be seen.
The Trapper lies dormant, taking what nourishment
it can from the ground, until a living creature passes
within range of its vines. The vines will suddenly come
alive, grappling and squeezing its prey until it drags
the prey into the now open bud of the plant to be
dissolved by the acid it secretes inside the bud. The
Trapping Plant can drag a captured prey at a rate of 1
foot per round until it can be encapsulated by the bud.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

This acid cannot dissolve metal, so all bits of metal
are eventually deposited at the base of the bud. This
often serves as a lure to attract other unwary creatures
or beings. Older Trapping Plants will sometimes use
these bits of metal to create a trail that the unwary
might follow. There has also been at least one report
of a Trapping Plant flinging a dagger or two in the
direction of people passing by to attract their attention,
so that they will investigate, and come into reach.

~Sentients~

Sometimes, for reasons unknown, some Treants go
rogue. They lose their temperance and their intellect
slowly fades away, while they regress to a more
primitive state. They become cruel and grudging, to
the point of becoming extremely dangerous to other
living beings. The final step of their transformation is
said to become normal, inanimate plants. Those “evil”
Treants are often referred to as Huorns.

Twiglings — Sz: Tiny, 30”-40” tall, 40-62 lbs,
Encountered: 2-10

Unlike the violence precipitated by many dangerous
plants, there are a number of plant-based creatures who are
truly sentient, thinking beings. We have included a few of
them to get you started.

Awakened Trees & Treants — Sz: Colossal, 15’-30’
tall, 4,000-5,000 lbs, Encountered: 1 or (Conclave) 5-50

Special Abilities: Treants have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Animate Trees: May animate up to 2 trees at a time.
Treants only.
•• Structural Slayer: Does double damage against
artificial structures
An Awakened Tree, also known as a Treant in the old
tongue, is a sentient, highly intelligent creature resembling
an old, tall deciduous tree, with a human-like visage,
branches for arms, and roots for legs. They are ancient
creatures and their origin is uncertain and disputed among
scholars of all Kins. Whatever the truth may be, it is destined
to remain a mystery since even the Treants themselves have
either forgotten their origin or keep it secret.
There is a really important distinction between
what is commonly called an Awakened Tree and what
a true Treant is: the first being only a partially sentient
animated tree, possibly created and controlled by the
will of the latter. They may appear very similar on the
surface - although the Awakened Tree is more “rough”
and only vaguely humanoid - but a true Treant is a
completely different matter: an ancient creature of
great power and wisdom.
Some scholars believe that if a Treant animates a
given tree too often that it will eventually Awaken and
become sentient.
Normally, Treants are extremely reclusive, calm, and
peaceful creatures. They live most of their thousands of
years long lives in solitary confinement in the depths
of the oldest forests. There, they remain still most of
the time, contemplating the perfect beauty of Nature
and remembering ancient times when the world was
younger. But don’t be tricked by their usual kindness,
for a Treants’s wrath is something no minion of the
Darkmaster will ever want to behold, mainly because it
would be the last thing they would ever see.

262

Special Abilities: Twiglings have the following abilities:
•• Thorn Dart: May shoot a thorn dart (treat as Short
Bow) once per round from its hand.
•• Vegetable Elasticity: May stretch arms out to 10’ in
length to grapple, or use as a whip, or out to 5’ with a
knob on the end (treat as flail).
Scholars have about as many theories of the origins
of Twiglings as there are Scholars out there that know
of these elusive little beings. What little is known of
them is yet to be fully proven. Are they some sort of
nature elemental? Are they baby Treants? Are they a
new type of Fey? Are they a magical construct escaped
into the wild? We may never know as those Twiglings
who deign to speak with the larger Kins rarely tell the
same tale twice.
They resemble little men made out of twigs and
branches woven together, with a fern-like leafy
hair. Both male and female Twiglings have been
encountered, and it is thought that the female generates
a seed which they plant and which eventually grows
into a young Twigling. This has not been proven.
Twiglings are able to stretch out their arms to a
maximum of 10’ in length. At this length, they can use
their arms to wrap around and climb trees, to grapple
with foes or even as a whip to attack them. They often
extend their arms out to a lesser distance of about 5’,
with a knob on the end instead of their normal fingers.
They use this in the same manner that a Wooden Flail is
used, as a flexible bashing weapon. They are also capable
of shooting a thorn from their palm. This has the same
ranges and modifiers as a Short Bow would have.
It is not know if the Twiglings need to eat or
if they can somehow draw life from the land. In
truth, Twiglings sink roots into the ground, their
legs stretching out much like their arms do, to draw
nurishment from the ground. This is also how they
sleep when outdoors. They are able to eat and usually
prefer acorns and other seed pods, though almost any
vegetable matter will suffice. They never eat meat.
Many a forest is inhabited by Twiglings, each with its
own range of a few miles. They care for and tend these
forests, often hidden from all. However, wanton damage
to their forests will draw their ire, and they can be quite
forceful in teaching manners to the larger Kins.

Spells = Giants use their Knw bonus for casting spells. They know 1 Spell Lore per level, and all of their spells are based on their focal (i.e. Fire Giants use Fire spells, Forest
Giants know spells that are useful in the Forest, etc.)

~Giants~
These are huge muscular people, possessing great strength,
but lacking in the agility found among the smaller Kins.
Many of these beings will eat the smaller Kin, considering
them to be a delicacy of sorts. The more intelligent will often
disguise this proclivity from visitors, hoping to lull them into
a sense of complacency before having them for dinner.
Some Giants aspire for a civilized life, building intricate stone
castles upon craggy peaks or, as some legends say, conjuring
enchanted homes upon a magical cloud. Others may content
themselves in simple caves or in the wilderness.
Note: Combat Skills are listed with damages like
(DR+6). This means that the Giant does increased
damage for the weapon that they are using through
a combination of it being larger than normal and the
Giant’s extreme strength. Thus a Giant’s Short Sword
would do 14s/13p instead of 8s/7p like normal.

Fire Giants are militaristic, prefering to dwell in
castles, walled towns, or near active volcanoes. They
often tap into and use things such as lava flows in their
construction. They are also good metal smiths, and
often wear metal armors.

Forest — Sz: Huge, 11’-14’ tall, 1,200-2,400 lbs, Encountered:

Fire — Sz: Huge, 12’-16’ tall, 2,250-4,000 lbs, Encountered: 1-10
Special Abilities: Fire Giants have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Giants is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kins.
•• Immunity: Fire Giants are immune to all heat and fire
based attacks.
•• Susceptibility: Fire Giants take double damage from
Cold based attacks.
•• Hot Rocks: Fire Giants can heat their metal weapons
or rocks that they throw so that they deal an extra 10
points of damage from the heat. This may be done once
per day per level that they have.
Fire Giants have stocky builds, resembling that of
Dwarves. They all have vibrant red hair, often streaked
with blonde, much like how flames look. Their eyes
are often glowing red or orange, like burning coals.
They often sport long, unruly beards.
263

1-2 (during the day) or 10-50 (nightly camp)

Special Abilities: Forest Giants have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Giants is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kins.
•• Pass witout Trace: Forest Giants leave no trace of their
passing when within a forest.
•• Speak with Animals: Forest Giants are able to speak
with any animal that normally lives within a forest.
•• Tree Shape: Once per day per level, the Forest Giant
can transform into a large tree. They use this as a
method of resting and sleeping and healing.
Forest Giants act as the wardens of the deepest and
wildest regions of forests, taking care of them and their
inhabitants. They believe that their role is to preserve
and protect the forests. They are an isolated Kin, rarely
meeting to trade with other Kins.
In appearance, Forest Giants appear much as Wood
Elves, just of much larger proportions.
Forest Giants rarely build permanent homes,
but that does not mean that they leave the forest
untouched. They clear dead underbrush, and often
cultivate sections of their forests into elaborate mazes
or living temples.
They are slow to anger, and are usually peaceful and
artistic, living in harmony with their forests. They are
normally good natured, but distrustful of outsiders.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Frost — Sz: Huge, 14’-16’ tall, 2,400-3,500 lbs, Encountered: Hill — Sz: Large, 9’-13’ tall, 700-1,900 lbs, Encountered:
1-2 (alone) or 10-20 (tribe)

1-6 (family)

Special Abilities: Frost Giant have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Giants is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kins.
•• Immunity: Frost Giants are immune to all cold based
attacks.
•• Susceptibility: Frost Giants take double damage from
heat and fire based attacks.
Frost giants skin is pale blue or white, like that of a
frozen corpse, and always cold to the touch. Their hair
and eyes usually match, being yellow, white, or light
blue. Frost giants wear their hair (and beards) long,
often braided, and sometimes coated in rime.
Around half of all frost giants live in nomadic
tribes. They follow herd animals, raiding settlements
they encounter along the way and taking temporary
shelter in glacial or earthen dugouts. Other frost giants
live in permanent settlements, usually in caves of ice or
stone, or built from the blocks of ancient ruins. Here
the frost giants hoard the spoils of their raids against
nearby settlements and passing caravans. Might makes
right among the frost giants.
The strongest giant is named the Jarl, and he or she
rules the tribe until another can defeat them in single
combat. The frost giants view smaller peoples as food
or slaves. When a tribe is on the move, its slaves are
chained to a slave handler; a figure who receives great
respect among the frost giants.

Special Abilities: Hill Giants have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Giants is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kins.
Hill Giants are hideous even by giant standards.
Their skin is normally a ruddy tan. Their hair and eyes
are usually black or brown. Their facial features are
ill proportioned. Hill giant clothing is a patchwork of
untreated hides and other humanoids’ castoffs.
Most Hill Giant tribes are nomadic. Though they
prefer temperate hills, these giants are able to survive
in a range of climates and terrains, due to their
hardiness and stubbornness. They lair in natural caves
and abandoned ruins.
Hill Giants value strength above all else. Fortunately
for other Kins, Hill Giants are also lazy and
shortsighted, and many folktales tell of heroes using
deceptive talk or magic to escape from them.
There are rare instances of lone Hill Giants
developing consciences. Such Giants might even be
adopted by small communities where they serve as
laborers or defenders, but they face ostracism from
most other humanoids and their own Kin.

Stone — Sz: Huge, 10’-15’, 900-3,000 lbs, Encountered: 1-3

264

(alone) or 10-30 (village)

Special Abilities: Stone Giants have the following
abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Giants is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kin.
•• Stone Speech: Stone Giants can hear the voices of stone.
The older the Giant, the better they can hear them.
•• Shape Stone: Stone Giants may shape stone as if it were
clay. This may be done for 10 minutes per day for each
level that the Stone Giant has.
Hairless skin that is the color and texture of rock are the
hallmarks of a Stone Giant. They could easily be mistaken
for extremely large statues, at least until they move.
Their wide, angular features are reminiscent of primitive
scultures, and work to reinforce this impression.
Stone Giants prefer living in rocky terrain, ideally
in mountainous regions, above the tree line, but below
the snow line. They make their homes in comfortable
stone caverns, that have been shaped to make them
more appealing to the Stone Giants.
Stone Giants generally disdain agriculture, preferring
to trade with other groups, if they are available. However,
they will raise sheep and goats, and will sometimes
cultivate grapes to use in making their own wine.
Small villages of Stone Giants are always ruled by
the elders of the village, those who can best hear the
voices of the stones where they make their homes.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Ogre — Lesser: Sz: Large, 7’-8’ tall, 350-500 lbs; Greater: Sasquatch/Yeti — Sz: Large, 7’-9’ tall, 300-700 lbs,
Sz: Large, 8’-10 tall, 500-1,000 lbs; Encountered: 1-2

2-3 young, Encountered: 1-6

Special Abilities: Ogres have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Ogres is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kins.
Ogres are the smallest of the Kins known as
Giantkin. They are not true Giants, but scholars
believe that they may be related.
They are slovenly and unkempt, disgusting in the
extreme. Their knotted, misshapen muscles and ugly
faces contribute to make their appearance even more
frightening. They are often covered in shaggy hair, and
wear stinking, uncured hides as clothing. They are usually
either solitary in nature, or they live in small family groups.
Ogres are slow-witted and cruel and considered to be a
greater evil than many other types of giants. Their strength
and savagery make them highly feared. Luckily, finesse is
not one of their strong suits. They fight using Cudgels and
other type of clubs. They also have a tendency to throw
things at foes. Usually this means rocks that are lying about
nearby, but may also include whatever happens to be near,
including other adventurers.
Ogres will often appropriate some existing cave or
structure and then terrorize the surrounding region.
They like shiny things and often amass a treasure from
the things that they take from local travelers.

Special Abilities: Sasquatch have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Camoflage Pelt: Changes colors and shades, granting a
+10 to Stealth rolls.
Sasquatch are large humanoids covered in long,
shaggy fur. They prefer to live in forested areas, well away
of civilization. Their cousins, the Yeti, prefer to live in cold
climes, where snow covers the ground most of the year.
Sasquatch are rarely seen except in their most ungaurded
moments, leaving many thing that they are not quite real, if
only they did not occassionally leave tracks.
Sasquatch have terrifying claws on their hands, and
the fangs in their mouth are all prime indicators of
their carnivorous diet.

Troll — Lesser: Sz: Large, 7’-9’ tall, 400-700 lbs; Greater:

265

Sz: Large, 8’-11’ tall, 450-1,200 lbs; War: Sz: Large,
9’-11’ tall, 650-900 lbs, Encountered: 1-2 (Lesser), 1
(Greater), 5-10 (War)

Special Abilities: Trolls have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Reach: Melee range for Trolls is 10’ rather than the
standard 5’ of most Kins.
•• Regeneration: Heals 1 Hit per minute as long as the
damage is not from magic, magic weapons, or fire. Those
types of damage take the normal amount of time to heal.
Trolls are large, misshapen humanoids with green
skin and moss-like hair and wicked claws on the end of
their arms. They are able to use those claws to literally
rip the limbs off of another creature or being.
A Troll is tremendously strong and savage, willing
to fight and kill nearly anything it encounters. It is
incredibly tough and regenerates most damage easily.
It can even regrow lost limbs and body parts in 2 to 20
minutes, depending upon how much flesh needs to be
regrown. Trolls can even reattach lost limbs by simply
holding the limb to the stump for 1 minute.
The only damage that cannot be regrown or
regenerated is that inflicted by fire or acid. In fact,
experienced Troll hunters know that the only way to
permanently kill a Troll is to make sure that every
single piece has been destroyed by fire. Luckily, if a
Troll is hacked into multiple pieces, only the largest
piece will regrow into the Troll.

Griffons and Gryphons share many stats. For those that they do not, the first number is for Griffons, the second for Gryphons.

Mythic Creatures are any creatures that are unusual or have
magical abilities, or which may be classified as magical hybrids.
Essentially, any creature that does not fall within the standard
guidelines of another category are listed as Mythic Creatures.

Blood Bird — Sz: Tiny, 1’ long, 2’-3’ wingspan, 3-5 lbs,

Almiraj — Sz: Miniscule, 10”-30” long, 8-16 lbs, 4”-8”

horn, 2-6 young, Encountered: 1-2
Almiraj resemble Coinyn (p. 237) in many ways.
The largest difference is that these hares have a single
onyx horn spiraling up to a point atop their heads.
Almiraj tend to protect other herbivores, acting as
champions of the fields and forests. They will protect
other herbivores against other animals such as foxes
or wolves, and in some cases, even against sentient
hunters, such as humans.
Almiraj attack by charging and leaping from the
ground to impale their targets upon their horn. They
then use their powerful back legs to free themselves,
racing around to build up the speed for another attack.
Almiraj have an innate knowledge of the Druidism
Spells: Camouflage and Forest Movement. They have
3 Mana Points per level and use their Knw bonus for
casting these 2 Spells. They use these to help protect
the denizens of their forests.

266

2-8 eggs, Encountered: 3-30
A single Blood Bird is rarely more than a minor
nuisance. Unfortunately, they
tend to swarm in groups of 3
to 30 blood Birds.
They stab with their long
sharp beaks, and if successful,
they will always do at least 1 to
5 points of Bleeding Damage
(each Success Level does 1 Hit
of Bleeding). They then follow
this up by grabbing their prey
tightly while they continue to
drain the prey of blood.
Once they have drained an amount equal to their
number of Hit Points, the Blood Bird will detach and
go find a place to sleep off the lethargic effects of this
feeding. Until they have slept for at least an hour, the
Blood Bird is limited to half their normal Move Rate
once they finish feeding.
While Blood Birds tend to go after prey that cannot
defend itself, like cattle or other herd beasts, they are
not above attacking humans and others if they are
hungry enough.

Carrion Beast — Sz: Huge, 10’-18’ long, 2’-4’ tall, 10-

Demon Dog — Sz: Medium, 5’-7’ long, 30”-42” tall, 4060 lbs, Encountered: 1-6

20 eggs, Encountered: 1-2
The Carrion Beast resembles a gigantic centipede
and other similar creatures when it is crawling along. It
often feasts upon dead creatures, or what is left by other
creatures when they finish with their prey.
Unfortunately, especially for adventurers, the Carrion
Beast is not above making a fresh kill in order to eat.
When it attacks, it will rear up, lifting the front half of
its body up to use its multiple claws to attack prey.
Rural towns and villages dread having one attracted to
their area as they are decidely hard to get rid of, especially
for those who are unused to dealing with such creatures.
It is rumored that there are some versions of this
creature that also have acidic saliva (treat as Bleed
damage from acid, equal to Success Levels earned, in
addition to normal Critical Results), and scholars even
came across one report of a Carrion Beast that had small
bolts of lightning arcing between its antenna and which
could actually fling this at those it attacked. This should
be treated as 10 Lightning (15ee) if included.

Special Abilities: Trolls have the following abilities:
•• Dark Sight: As decribed on p. 206.
•• Acute Senses: Gains +3 to all Perception and Tracking rolls.
•• Immunity: Immune to all poisons and venoms.
•• Penetrating Bite: Its bite attacks ignore 1/2 of all
Armor Ratings when it attacks.
Demon Dog is regional name for the Barghest, which is
also called the Black Dog or Spectral Dog in some cultures.
Whatever name it is known by, it is a fierce and dangerous
beast that is only encountered at night.
It is covered in a dark black fur, and has glowing red
eyes that seem to be filled with the fires of hell. This makes
it look like a large, dark furred wolf, and is sometimes
mistaken as such.
Their primary method of attacking is their savage
bite, but they have been known to simply make attacks
by knocking targets into bogs or other hazards. More
rarely, they have been known to breathe fire in a cone, 35
feet long that is 15 feet wide at its furthest point. Luckily,
Demon Dogs are only able to use their Fire Breath no
more than once per level each day.

Cockatrice — Sz: Tiny, 2’-3’ long, 10-15 lbs,
Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Cockatrice have the following abilities:
•• Petrification Bite: Reflex Save against the level of the
Cockatrice to avoid Petrification
The Cockatrice is a small relative of the more rightly
feared Basilisk. In appearance, it resembles a reptillian
chicken with a tail, with scales and leathery wings rather
than feathers.
It prefers to roost up in trees, well above the ground, and
to drop on the small creatures that compose its diet.
However, like the Basilisk, the Cockatrice can
petrify creatures who meet its eyes. The duration of
petrification can often be lessened through the use of
herbs, spells, or even rituals.

Cockatrice can be found nearly anywhere. A sure

Special Abilities: Eye Beasts have the following abilities:
•• Dark Sight: As decribed on p. 206.
•• Eye Blast: Large central eye is not an eye, but can shoot a
Lightning Bolt from what appears to be its pupil. May use
this attack a number of times per day equal to its level.
•• See Invisible: Able to see invisible at will.
The Eye Beast, sometimes referred to as the Oculus, is
called that because of the huge single eye in the middle
of the floating sphere that makes up its body, located just
above the huge maw filled with teeth the size of daggers.
The sphere is covered with what appear to be 10 eyestalks.
Two of those are actually tentacles tipped with hooked
claws, that can strike out to a range of 10’.
Since its eyes are actually on stalks that can bend
and wave freely in any direction, the Eye Beast is almost
impossible to surprise. Especially since there have been
reports from adventurers that it can see invisible creatures
and beings with no problem at all.

Flying Razortooth — Sz: Small, 2’-3’ diameter, 5-10 lbs, Grannock — Sz: Large, 4’-5’ tall, 500-800 lbs,
3’ long arms tipped with hooked claws, Encountered: 1-5
This creature resembles a giant floating ball of fur with
3 eyes on the ends of small (6”) stalks atop of its body,
and a huge gaping maw filled with razor sharp teeth.
From each side of the creature protrudes a spindly armlike limb ending in a single large hooked claw.
It tends to float along serenely, often drifting with
the wind, until it spots prey, at which point, it will
quickly zip towards that prey. It then grabs its prey
with the hooked claws and holds its prey close while it
devours attempts to devour that prey.

Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Grannock have the following abilities:
•• Dark Sight: As decribed on p. 206.
•• Burrowing: May burrow through 10’ of sedimentary
rock per minute, 50’ of dirt per minute, harder
substances may take longer
•• Confusion Spray: from openings just above mouth
(not nose), 10’ radius sphere, WSR vs Gannock’s Level
or confused for 1d10 rounds (may only defend). Targets
get +5 vs spray if in combat.
Grannock are predators that operate almost
completely in subterranean locales. They are intelligent,
and have their own language. Their favorite prey are
those Kins that live or work underground. They also
prey on various other underground creatures.
It has been reported that Grannocks like to bury
any shiny objects that they get from victims in their
lairs, which are often lined with the carapaces and
bones of their prey.
Grannock conceal the burrows that lead to their lairs,
which means that they could be encoutered above ground
as they move from one tunnel to another. They have also
been know to undermine the floors of their burrows, and
other underground tunnels to create pit traps.

Fossivore — Sz: Large, 8’-12’ long, 500-1,500 lbs,
Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Fossivores have the following abilities:
•• Phasing: Is able to phase through solid matter like
others swim through water.
The Fossivore is an unusual creature at the very least.
It got this name because it devours metals such as iron,
silver, or gold, as well as minerals such as coal or sulfer, and
anything else that might be mined from the ground.
The Fossivore often travels near the surface, with
only the bony plate on its back sticking up out of the
ground, much like the fin of a shark in the ocean. This
has earned this creature the nickname of landshark.
The Fossivore cannot attack or consume its food
while it is phasing. While it is phasing, it can only be
affected by magical weapons. Many are thankful that it
has never learned to phase while in battle.

Griffon/Gryphon — Sz: Large, 5’-6’ tall, 6’-8’ long,

Gargoyle — Sz: Medium, 2’-6’ tall, 100-500 lbs,
Encountered: 1-10 or 2-20

Special Abilities: Gargoyles have the following abilities:
•• Night Animation: Transforms to stone statues in
daylight. Transform to flesh (fully healed, as long as all
pieces within a few feet) once the sun goes down.
•• Dark Sight: As decribed on p. 206.
Gargoyles resemble terrifying statues. Most have wings,
leathery or feathered. No two gargoyles have the same
features. Some have fangs while others might have beaks,
but all have claws which they can use to attack. They range
in size from the size of a fox to larger than human.
Gargoyles like to collect shiny objects and stash
them near where they roost. And where you find one
Gargoyle, you are sure to find anywhere up to 20 more
in the same area, wilderness or city.

268

300-400 lbs, 30’ wingspan, 4-8 eggs, Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Both Griffons and Gryphons have the
following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
Gryphons are, based upon the face they show
others, often considered to be savage creatures that
are compelled by a horrendous bloodlust at the mere
smell of blood. Their cousins, the Griffons, however
are exactly this. The Gryphons use that reputation to
help protect themselves.
The main difference between the two is sometimes
difficult to see. The Gryphons have a mild brindled pattern
to the fur of their lion-like hindquarters, and the feathers
of their eagle-like heads, forequarters, and wings tend to
have a metalic sheen. Griffons on the other hand, have
unpatterned tawny fur and simply colored feathers.
Griffons are highly prized if captured in the egg or as
young cubs, since they can be trained as mounts that are
fiercely loyal and obedient to none but their rider.
Gryphons fiercely protect their nests and would hunt
down any who attempt to steal their eggs or young. They
have a cunning and intelligence to make them much
more dangerous than their wild cousins. Gryphons will
use tactics such as diving with the sun behind them,
making it harder to see them coming.
Gryphons also have their own language and if you can
get one to trust you, they can provide you with insights
and information that they have gleaned from their
centuries of life.

Jackalope — Sz: Tiny, 20”-40” long, 12-20 lbs, 6”-10” Lycanthrope, Werewolf — Sz: Medium, 6’-7’ tall,
antlers, 4-8 young, Encountered: 1-2
The Jackalope are much like the Coinyn (p. 237) ,
except that they have small antelope-like antlers.
This is a very timid creature, and when threatened,
it attempts to bolt for the safety of its den. However,
if cornered, it will turn and attempt to shed blood
with its antlers.

200-300 lbs, mortal form based on Kin, Encountered: 1-5

Special Abilities: Werewolves have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Susceptibility: Werewolves takes 5 Hits per Round from
simply coming in contact with silver. They also receive a -3
to Brawn and Dexterity while in contact with silver.
•• Susceptibility: Wounds from magical or silvered
weapons heal normally, not through regeneration, and
they can kill a Werewolf.
•• Regeneration: Heals from all forms of damage, except from
silver or magical sources, at a rate of 1 Hit per minute.
Werewolves are a type of lycanthrope that transforms
into a creature that is half man and half wolf. There are
even rumors of werewolves who can shift all the way
into wolf form, but that has yet to be proven.
As with other Lycanthropes, they tend to avoid each
other, only coming together on the nights of the full
moon when they must transform.
Those who hate what they are try to avoid
civilization when they know they will soon change,
while those who revel in it, prefer towns and cities, as
it makes the hunting for victims easier.

~Lycanthrope~
Lycanthropes are shape-shifters. They are mortal men
and women who are forced, under the light of the full moon,
and in other stressful moments, to transform into dangerous
creatures with no control.
Lycanthropy is a magical disease that is transmitted via the
saliva of the were-creature when it bites an uninfected person,
but only if a Critical Damage result that inflicts Bleeding
damage occurs. Should the person actually survive being
bitten, he must make a Toughness Save against the level of the
Lycanthrope or he will contract lycanthropy himself. Only
one Save is required, after the attack is over, and only if the
victim survives the attack.
On the nights of the full moon, the Lycanthrope will not
be able to control himself and will change, and then hunt
whatever prey is available.
If the lycanthrope, in its mortal form, takes any Critical
Damage, he must make a Will Save to avoid changing into his
were-form (see Lycanthropy on p. 75 for more information
on this). Should the lycanthrope be subject to a Will Save
against fear, either natural or magical, and fails, then he will
automatically transform into a his were-creature form as well.

Manticore — Sz: Large, 4’-10’ long, 250-700 lbs, 1-4

Lycanthrope, Wererat — Sz: Small, 3’-4’ tall, 100150 lbs, mortal form based on Kin, Encountered: 1-10

Special Abilities: Wererats have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Susceptibility: Lycanthropes takes 5 Hits per Round from
simply coming in contact with silver. They also receive a -3
to Brawn and Dexterity while in contact with silver.
•• Susceptibility: Wounds from magical or silvered
weapons heal normally, not through regeneration, and
they can kill a Lycanthrope.
•• Regeneration: Heals from all forms of damage, except from
silver or magical sources, at a rate of 1 Hit per minute.
Wererats, in their were-form resemble humanoid rats,
with glowing red eyes, and a taste for blood. They tend
to gather in small packs when they know that they must
transform, avoiding each other in their mortal forms.

269

young; Encountered: 1-5

Special Abilities: Trolls have the following abilities:
•• Dark Sight: As decribed on p. 206.
•• Poison: 10th level poison, deals 1d10 Hits for 1 Round
per each point that the Save is failed by. Poison also
makes the target be at -5 to all actions for 24 hours.
The Manticore is a scary beast at best. It has the
body of a lion, with a head that sort of resembles that
of a human, large bat-like wings, and a tail like that of a
scorpion. They are coarse, slovenly beasts that favor the
flesh of sentient peoples. They often reek of fresh blood
and decaying flesh. This odor often giving notice of their
presence. Their preferred habitat includes underground
sewers, caverns, crypts, and ruins.
There are rumors of variations of Manticores that
have a lion-like tail whose tip looks like it is covered
in porcupine quills. Those who claim to have seen this
variation swear that the beast can whip its tail and
shoot forth an iron-like quill (treat as if an arrow shot
from a short bow, use Stinger attack) coated in the same
poison described above.

Pegasus — Sz: Large, 7’-8’, 900-1,200 lbs, 30’-35’ wingspan, Slithering Maw — Sz: Huge, 2’-3’ diameter, 10’-12’ long,
1-2 young, Capacity: 300 lbs, Encountered: 1 or 20-50 (herd)

4 tentacles, each about3’-4’ in length, Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Pegasi have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
The Pegasus is a winged horse. They are almost
always a white or light grey in color and tend to have
wingspans of up to 11 meters (35 feet).
Wild Pegasi (the plural of Pegasus) tend to stay to
the high meadows and fields when they land.
These beautiful creatures just want to be left alone
with their simple lives. They enjoy soaring high above
the fields and forests and of flying through the peaks
with their challenging crosswinds.
Pegasus are deeply protective of their young and
will fight to the death to protect or rescue them. Their
normal tactic is to ram into a foe, knocking them
prone and then to use their hooves to trample them
into the dust.

Special Abilities: Slithering Maws have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
The Slithering Maw was given that name because
it is, essentially, a very very large snake-like creature.
Around its large, beak-like mouth, it has four tentacles
that it uses to help catch its prey.
The Slithering Maw shuns daylight, living in caverns,
caves and other shadowy
locations under the earth.
Slithering Maws lurk
near high traffic areas
looking for prey. If it kills
the prey, it does not eat it
there, but it drags it back
to its lair to eat later, a
small bit at a time.
While the Slither Maw
does not collect trasure,
it is likely that there are
items in its lair that it
cannot digest, so just get
tossed to the side.

Rock Squid — Sz: Huge, 9’-12 long cylindrical body, 3’-4’
thick, 6 tentacles, up to 45’ in length, Encountered: 1-2

Special Abilities: Rock Squids have the following abilities:
•• Dark Sight: As decribed on p. 206.
•• Poison: Tentacle claws covered in poison, TSR vs Rock
Squid’s level or become Weary and -2 ro Brawn for 1
hour per point that Save is failed by.
When holding still, the Rock Squid can look like
any other stalagmite or stalactite, depending on where
it is, since it can easily stick to walls and ceilings in the
natural caverns that it loves to inhabit.
The creature has 3 eyes, allowing it to see in all
directions, and a single large mouth that it uses to
consume what it catches.
From its rocky looking
body, the Rock Squid can
extrude six tentacles, each
is tipped in a rocky claw. It
uses these tentacles to reach
out and grab prey and then
drag that prey to its mouth
so that it can consume it.
The tentacles are covered
in the same rough, rocklike
hide as its body, but
delivering Critical Damage
against a tentacle will cause
it to release whatever that
particular tentacle is holding.
While the Rock Squid
does not collect treasure, such can often be found
nearby since the Rock Squid does not consume metals
of any type, so such are left behind.
Rock Squids are solitary creatures, they reproduce by
fissioning into two smaller creatures which will then go
their own ways, to find their own hunting grounds.

Sobekor (Winged Crocodile) — Sz: Huge, 5’-7’ length,

270

10’-20’ wingspan, 50-180 lbs, 6-12 eggs, Encountered: 1-4

Special Abilities: Sobekor have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
This is an usual and rare creature. It is a two meter
long creature that resembles a crocodile with a pair of
feathered wings about midway down its back.
The creature is equally at home in the water as it is
in the air. On land, however, it is slightly slower overall.
Scholars think that this creature was the creation of an
insane priest of the crocodile god known as Sobek, and it is
from this deity that the creature gets its name.
The creature itself lairs in slow moving rivers or bogs,
usually in an underwater cave of some sort since it is
an air breather. This is because the creature is found
almost exclusively in such environments. A favorite
tactic of this beast is to dive out the sky while its prey
is near the edge of the water and if it can get a good
hold with its bite, drag the prey into the water, rolling it
around and around until the prey stops moving. It then
drags it to its lair to eat at its leisure.

Unicorn — Sz: Large, 7’-8’, 900-1,200 lbs, 1-2 young, Ursator — Sz: Large, 6’-10’ long, 500-700 lbs, 50% of 2-6
Capacity: 300 lbs, Encountered: 1, or 2-3 (mated pair &
foal) or 20-50 (migratory herd)

Special Abilities: Unicorns have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Horn: Neutralizes any poison or disease within a 10’
radius of the Unicorn. If removed, the radius is only 6”.
Legends abound about the Unicorn. Many believe
that they are highly magical and would make stupendous
mounts with their shining white coats, pearl-like spiralling
horn, and tails and manes of silky hair. Legends also tell
that only virgins can tempt the beast into captivity.
However, nothing could be further from the truth.
Yes, they are beautiful creatures, but they are also very
bloodthirsty as well. They enjoy skewering hapless prey
on their horns and then devouring the remains in a
leisurely manner.
Unicorns do have a natural grace to go along with
that ethereal beauty that they possess, but that is just
the lure that they use to draw prey, usually humans,
into striking distance.
Unicorn horns do have magical abilities (described
above). This, along with other properties that the horn
of a Unicorn are purported to have make them highly
prized by alchemists and many an adventurer have
been hired to procure them, providing lots of food for
the Unicorn’s slaughter.
Additionally, Unicorns are so finely in tune with their
natural surroundings that they are never Surprised, and
they will always spot any traps that are laid for them in
their forest home.
Most of the time, Unicorns are solitary creatures, but
during mating season, they tend to pair up and have a
single foal. The mated pair remain together until the foal
is can take care of itself.
Every 10 years or so, according to scholars, Unicorns
will form a herd as they migrate to a new region, which
take anywhere from a few weeks to up to a year or two.
This also often results in the loss of any settlements in
their path, or a drop in local wildflife in the path of
their travels. Once in their new region, they once again
take off on their own until their next migration. Not
every Unicorn joins this migration, only about half of
those in a given region leave, until their population
once again increases. Some scholars believe that this
periodic migration is because Unicorns each need a
minimum amount of territory.

cubs if encountering a mated pair, Encountered: 1-5

Special Abilities: Ursator have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
These large predators resemble a large bear, with extra
large claws, but with a head that resembers a bird of prey,
usually that of some type of raptor. However, scholars
report that there have sightings of Ursator with heads
that resemble other bird of prey, like an owl or an eagle,
or even that of some species of vulture.
These creatures are primarily forest dwellers, though
they have been found on mountainsides and broken
hills as well, so long as prey has been plentiful.
When prey has been scarce, Ursator have been known
to wander into civilized lands. They have also been known
to change their habitat if another, larger predator, such as
a dragon or wyvern moves into their home region.
In combat, the Ursator tend to go after the most
dangerous melee opponents first. Scholars tend to
argue over whether this is due to their attraction to
shiny objects, such as armor and swords, or if they are
smart enough to determine who is the biggest threat.
Mated Ursator tend to have anywhere from 2 to 6
cubs at a time, either parent will hunt for food for thier
young. If both parents have to leave their young for
any length of time, they tend to block the entrance to
their lairs enough to prevent the cubs from leaving.
Scholars also caution that if you come across
untended Ursator cubs, your smartest move is to
turn around and leave before the parents return, and
to not hurt the cubs in any way as Ursator have been
known to track those who hurt their young for weeks
or months in order to destroy them.

Will-O-Wisp — Sz: Small, 1’-5’ radius at will, Encountered: 1

271

Special Abilities: Trolls have the following abilities:
•• Incorporeal: Will-o-wisps can only be injured by
magical attacks, normal weapons pass through their
bodies without resistance.
The Will-O-Wisp is a small ball of cold light that
floats through the mist that rises from fens and
marshes, often luring travellers through such dismal
locales towards certain danger.
The Wisp varies its brightness as it travels, both
confusing and attacting its prey to dangerous terrain
such as quicksand. Thus trapped, the Wisp will
envelope its prey to drain the warmth from their
bodies, though nothing can sate the preternatural cold
that the Wisp is comprised of.
If attacked, the Wisp will attack by ramming in
incorporeal body into a foe, and expanding to its
maximum 5’ radius. Doing so does cold damage to
what it attacked.

Pterosaur ­— Small: Sz: Small, 3’-4’ long body,10”-20”
beak, 10’-12’ wingspan, Encountered: 2-20; Large: Sz:
Medium, 5’-7’ long body, 3’-4’ long head (including
20”-30” beak), 15’-30’ wingspan, Encountered: 1-10

lbs, 1-2 young, Encountered: 3-30

Special Abilities: Ankylosaurs have the following abilities:
•• Club Tail: Prehensile tail end in huge bony club.
•• Susceptibility: Their underside as an Armor Rating of
B3/S5/P3/E2/SL0
Ankylosaur are large herbivores. They have low
slung bodies that are covered in thick bony plates
which is almost impossible to penetrate. Most
predators will attempt to attack their more vulnerable
necks or undersides. However, Ankylosaurs have a
good defense in that the tip of their long prehensile
tails are also massive clubs that they can use to attack
those who attack them.

Special Abilities: Pterosaurs have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Enhanced Sight and Smell: Pterosaurs receive a +10
to all Perception rolls involving sight and scent.
Pterosaurs, which includes pterodactyls and
pteranodons, are close relatives of dinosaurs and are,
in many ways, akin to ancient mammals. They tend to
roost in high crags and crevices.
Pterosaurs are covered in a short, fine fur, that looks
leathery from a distance. They have cruel talons and
their wings are formed of thin skin stretched between
elongated finger bones, much like the wings of a bat.
They have a phenomenal ability to glide for long
periods, which lets them soar for hours without
flapping. This also allows them to soar silently, until
they dive and attack, swooping and grabbing prey
and then heading back into the sky. This swoop attack
allows them to carry off prey weighing as much as 500
lbs in weight.

Brontosaur — Sz: Monstrous, 60’-90’ long body,

including 12’-24’ long neck and 15’-25’ tail, 25’-35’ tall
at the shoulder, 30-50 tons, Encountered: 10-100
Brontosaurs are herbivores, eating only plants.
Their size and height means that they can often reach
foilage in trees more than 30’ above the ground.
These grazing animals livi in large herds, and prefer
land that is near rivers and swamps, wading into the
water for protection. Since they tend to sink into the
mud due to their massive weight, they avoid lakes
when possible.

Entelodonts (Giant Boar) — Sz: Huge, 5’-7’ tall at

the shoulder, 5’-8’ long, 4”-6” upward curving tusks,
300-2,000 lbs, 2-10 piglets, Encountered: 1-10

Special Abilities: Giant Boars have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
These creatures are sometimes called Dire Pigs or
Hell Pigs, mostly because of their huge size. These
creatures are omnivores, eating anything. They are
quick and agile beasts, preferring forests over to plains.
If threatened or alarmed, they can be quite
dangerous. However, they are also unlikely to pass up
an easy meal, and one scholar once quipped that they
are not above a little carrion carry-out.

272

long, 35-40 lbs, Encountered: Solitary or pack (2-12)

Special Abilities: Raptoc have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Jumpers: Raptoc are able to leap up to 20’ in a single bound.
The Raptoc, sometimes known as a Velociraptor,
is a small feathered dinosaur with a long tail. It is an
excellent jumper, able to jump over obstacles with
ease, allowing it to move quickly across rugged terrain.
Raptocs are named for their resemblance to birds
of prey and for the tock-tock sound that the tapping
of their talons of their hind legs makes against stone.
Raptoc, like many dinosaurs, have extremely strong
jaw muscles allowing them to do massive amounts of
damage with their large mouths.
When hunting alone, the Raptoc has no problems
going after creatures twice its size or larger, and packs
of Raptocs have gone after even larger prey, such as the
Razorback Lizards.

Fantasy Express Copyright © 2023 by Tim Dugger and Firehawk Games. All rights reserved.

Terror Bird — Sz: Small-Huge, 3’-10’ tall, 150-1,000
lbs, 2-5 young, Encountered: 1-10

Special Abilities: Terror Birds have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
Many scholars claim that Terror Birds have a much
more scientific name, but few ever remember it, going
mainly with their more colloquial name.
These large flightless birds are very carnivourous,
subsisting on a diet of meat and little else.
Their preferred habitat is the open plains or in light
forests where they can move quickly and build up
speed. They have also been known to inhabit forests
of giant trees, and will attack anything on the ground.
Their normal hunting and combat tactic is to move
at their top speed and ram into prey, knocking it over
and then raking it with their claws. If they cannot
topple their prey, they will attack by biting. Both their
beaks and claws are very strong, able to rend metal, to
get at the soft bits underneath.

Razorback Lizard (Stegosaurus) — Sz: Gigantic,
20’-30’ long body, 14’ tall, 3,000-5,000 lbs, Encountered:
1 or 2-12 (herd)

Special Abilities: Razorback Lizards have the following
abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Tail Spikes: Has from 4-6 spikes on their tails, 20”-30” long
The Razorback Lizard is also known as a Stegosaurus.
It is a large, lizard-like creature with a double row of
tough plates with sharpened edges running down its
back. It is these plates that give the creature its name.
The Razorback Lizard also has a quite powerful tail
that has numerous spikes protruding from its tip.
While the plates, which are only used defensively,
protect the Razorback from larger predators, and its
tough hide protects from most other predators, it can
use its tail to attack with deadly effect.
The Razorback Lizard is a plant eater, grazing
among the foliage either alone or the rest of its herd.
When threatened, the herd will either stampede
away from the perceived danger, or circle up with the
weakest members in the center, tail spikes out, to do
the most damage as possible.

Smilodon — Sz: Huge, 6’-10’ long, 4-5’ tall at the shoulder,
2-3 cubs, Encountered: 1-2 (adults, & 4-6 cubs)

Special Abilities: Smilodons have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
The Smilodon is often called by its other name, the
Sabertooth Tiger. They get this name from the large
dagger-like teeth protruding down from their upper jaw.
These can be anywhere from 4 to 8 inches in length.
Unlike normal tigers, the Smilodons are not normally
striped. However, their fur is not a uniform hue either.
Adventurers have reported to scholars of encountering
versions of this creature that do have a subdued striped
or even a spotted pattern to their fur.
Smilodons often lair in caves or under rocky overhangs
and they are well suited to rugged open terrain. They like
to attack from ambush. They will make a quick charge,
often leaping up to 40 feet while on the run and knocking
down their prey. They then will use their strong claws or
fanged bite to finish off their prey.

Tricerotops — Sz: Gigantic, 25’-30 long, 8’-12’ tall, 6-8
tons, 2-4 young, Encountered: 3-30

Special Abilities: Tricerotops have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
•• Armored Head: 3 horns, 2 are 2’-4’ long, and nose
horn is 20”30” long.
•• Unarmored Body: Body has an AR of B3/S5/P3/E2/SL0.
The Triceratops is an formidable looking herbivore
with a unique appearance. It sports a large beak on its
massive head, which also covered with a thick bony plate
that sweeps up and back like a huge outstretched collar.
It also has two large forward-facing horns above its
small eyes, with a third on its nose.
The Triceratops always faces its foes to use its horns
to attack, and the bony plate that sweeps up over its
back to protect itself. The AR given in the stat block is
for attacks against this bony plate.
Tyranosaur — Sz: Monstrous, 40’-50’ long, including
10’-15’ tail, 12’-15’ tall, 5-7 tons, 3-5 eggs/young, Encountered: 1
Special Abilities: Tyranosaurs have the following abilities:
•• Night Sight: As decribed on p. 205.
This creature is sometimes referred to as the Terrible
Lizard or the King Lizard. It is a danger to all around
it, especially since it likes to hunt near the foraging
grounds of various herbivores.
It attacks my making a quick brutal charge to attack
the slowest of the herd it is going after. As with most of
its hunts, the old or weak provide the common fare.

* = Armor Ratings are for unarmored being. If the Undead is wearing armor, it should be added to AR given as well as any Movement Penalties that should be applied.
** = Innate means that the Undead has Special Abiltiies that can be used in attacking in some way.

All Undead have the following attributes in common:
•• Immunity: To all venoms and poisons.
•• Immunity: To all influence and control spells that
are not specifically designed for controlling or
influencing Undead.
•• Susceptibility: Hurt by Holy Water/Oil as described
in the Bless Water/Oil spell descriptions (p. 154).
•• Repulsed by Holy Symbol: Undead must make WSR
against the level of the wielder or avert its gaze and be
unable to approach wielder for 1 minute.
•• Undead Regeneration: All Undead will heal damage
from all forms of damage, except that to which they are
susceptible, at a rate of 1 Hit per minute. Should an undead
be reduced to zero Hits or below, this regeneration will
slow to a rate of 1 Hit per hour until they once again have
a positive value, and the regeneration will then resume at
1 Hit per minute.

~Undead~
Bordering upon, and even separating the Abyss and the
Nine Hells is a group of related planes known only as the
Shadow Realms. The Shadow Realms, Hades, and the Nether
Realms are collectively known as the Infernal Realms or the
Lower Planes (p. 187).
The Shadow Realms are the home of creatures and beings
that are neither alive nor dead, but somewhere in between.
The beings and creatures that live in the Shadow Realms are
collectively known by several different names, such as the
Undead, Unlife, the Deathless and more. They are usually the
remnants of evil souls that remain behind, trapped in between
life and death, unable to move on to their afterlife for all eternity.
Many are not even aware of their previous lives, only the most
powerful of such creatures retain any memories.
There are two main categories of Undead, Created and
Natural. Created Undead are those Undead which are created
through the use of spells, rituals, Soul Damage, or through a
transformation initiated by another Undead, such as a Vampire
turning another person into a Vampire. There are five main
Types of Created Undead, the Type indicating a general power
level or capability. Even Natural Undead are classified by Type.
Natural Undead are those that form spontaneously, such
as a Ghost forming when a person dies horrible and violent
death. In either case, the Undead forms on the mortal plane,
but it always has a connection to the Shadow Realms, since it is
the Shadow Realms that supplies the creature’s animating force.
When an Undead creature is destroyed on the mortal
plane, it isn’t truly destroyed. It is, instead banished to
Shadow Realms, there to spend eternity, unless summoned
forth by some daring or unwary spell caster.

~Created Undead~
Corpses animated by the foul spells and rituals of
Necromancers. While the corpses are preserved from
further decay, the spells do not normally restore their bodies
to what they were before their initial death.
One thing common with Created Undead is that unless they
are Controlled, they will attempt to attack the closest living being
with either their fists or whatever weapons that they have handy.
Since these Undead are mindless, they will never parry or attempt
to avoid attacks. Additionally, this lack of memory means that
if they are not being directly supervised or controlled, they will
forget any prey that stay out of their perception capabilities for
more than a minute (12 rounds).
